loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla was born in 1985. She is a married lady who has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions before having any children. 

Khawla has been selling blankets at her house for 3 years. After having expanded her customer base, she is seeking a youth loan now in order to buy more blankets so that she will raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Srey Neath

texts.en:
Srey Neath lives in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. Her youngest child attends school. This family's living depends mainly on their rice field. She and her husband have been doing the rice field for 12 years. They earn 22,000 KHR on average per day

She has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan has helped her family to improve their living. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her to expand her current business and to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and seeds

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy lives in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 35 years old, married and has six children. All of her children attend school except the youngest child who is now only four years old. This big family's living depends mainly on their rice field. She and her husband have been doing the rice field for 19 years. They earn 17,700 KHR on average per day

She has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helps her family to improve their living. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
Savoen lives in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 children. Her eldest child is 3 years old while the youngest is 4 months old. This family depends mainly on their rice field to make their living. Savoen and her husband have been working the rice field for 17 years. They earn 20,500 KHR, on average, per day

Savoen has completed 2 loans with VisionFund already. The previous loans helped her family in improving their living conditions. She is now requesting the third loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her to expand her current business,as well as to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn lives in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. All of her children attend school. This family depends mainly on their rice field to make a living. She and her husband have been working the rice field for 10 years. They earn 27,700 KHR, on average, per day.

Samorn has completed 1 loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan has helped her family in improving their standard of living. She is now requesting the second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the rice field. Samorn expects that the income will help her to expand her current business, to pay for the family's food and their health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Abianus

texts.en:
Abianus is a 50-year-old police officer who is married to Yakomina, 50, a worker. They have three children: Dicky, 25 years old and Asmin, 19 years old (both in college) and Anna, 15, in the first grade of Senior High School. 

Abianus cares about his children’s education.  He feels responsible for assisting his children in meeting their educational needs. He always tries to do his best for his children's future so that they can have better lives.

At the moment, Asmin and Anna need to buy some tools and books to support their education. Due to the lack of money, he requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education fees

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sofia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Sofia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia works hard to support her family. Vevencia is married and has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Vevencia has been in this business for 15 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business further. In the future, Vevencia would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Heoun

texts.en:
Hoeun lives in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 63 years old, married and has two dependent members in her family. This family's income depends mainly on their rice field. She and her husband have been working in the rice field for 22 years. They earn 15,200 KHR on average per day.

She has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helped her family improve their living standards. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Jazeel

texts.en: Jazeel was born in 1995. She is a single lady living with her family in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Jazeel has been selling stationary tools, doing research for students and printing articles at her house for one year in order to support her family financially. She is now seeking a youth loan to buy a new printing machine for her business, hoping that she will raise her productivity and profit.

loans.use: To buy a new printer for her business

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang lives in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 61 years old, married and has two dependent members in her family. The family depends mainly on their rice field. She and her husband have been working in the rice field for 24 years. They earn 13,800 KHR on average per day.

She has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helps her family in improving their living standards. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. 

Nang expects that the income will help her expand her current business and to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en: Junie is a furniture maker who worked in his own business and then decided to improve it. He has worked at this business activity for the past 10 years and it has allowed him to support his wife and six children. Junie is an entrepreneur who reinvests part of his profits into his farm. As a result, he has been able to achieve an increase in the output from his harvests. Currently, he joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy raw materials. In the future, he wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en:
A daughter of a public utility driver and a retail store owner, Reynalyn, 19 years old from Laur, Nueva Ecija, dreams of a stable life for her family. 

Reynalyn applied for an educational loan so that she could go to college. The loan PHP 40,000 will be very helpful to pay for her tuition fees. She wants to take up Microfinance Technology and own a business someday.  By doing so, Reynalyn sees a profitable business for her family and support for the studies of her two younger brothers.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for kitchen tools, food packaging (boxes, bags, plastic wrap, foil, etc.), various stocks of ingredients, cooling racks, baking dishes and other materials needed in baking.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal is a 22-year-old married lady who still has no kids. While staying at home, Iqbal started selling blankets two years ago, which raised their income. She is now applying for a youth loan to add more blankets and covers in addition to purchasing a collection of clothes.

loans.use: to add more blankets and clothes to her inventory

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay lives in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is now 54 years old. She is divorced and has one child. In order to support the family, she grows corn and sells porridge. She can earn 27,700 KHR on average per day.

She has already completed five loans with VisionFund, which can help her improve her family's living and income. She is now requesting a new loan from VisionFund and will use the money for purchasing fertilizer and seeds for her corn farm. She expects that the new loan will help her improve her living conditions, especially her nutrition, food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Wilma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer in Tala town, where she does dairy farming and also plants cash crops for selling. She is 40 years old, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the last 12 years, and she makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

Elizabeth plans to use this loan to pay school fees for her children. She also plans to buy dairy feeds for her dairy cows. She anticipates making more income with which she will save and also repay the loan.

She hopes to be successful in her farming business, make more income and be able to educate her children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with 1 child aged 2 years old. He used his previous loan to buy animal medicine to sell. He has been operating an animal drug shop and working as an extension worker in the veterinary department for 3 years to increase his income and hopes to build a house and educate his children in-spite of debtors not paying back. Matia is requesting a loan to buy veterinary medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy veterinary medicine to sell

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin joined GDMPC in 2011 to have an easy access to financial services.  He borrowed from GDMPC in addition to his capital. This loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Melvin expects an increase in sales so as to expand his business and improve the general living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Younes

texts.en: Younes is 20 years old. He lives with his parents and four brothers in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Younes is a university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in his third year. He is hoping to find a job in his study field after graduation so that he will support his family, who aren't able to pay for his study fees because of the financial crisis they have been facing. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sreyvo's Group

texts.en:
Sreyvo is a villager located in Kampong Cham province, and she is 23 years old. She is married and blessed with two little children at home. Cassava farming is the main source for her to earn income for supporting the family. She has been involved with this business for five years, and she can earn a decent income. 

Including this loan cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of a group consisting of two. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees. She hopes to expand her farmland to a larger scale than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is 32 years old and a mother of three kids; two of them are in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. To strive for a living, she does rice farming as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for 14 years, and it has earned her 44,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is not the first loan cycle for Oun and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has completely paid back the past loans. Now, she leads a group of two in order to apply for the new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees, and fertilizer and pesticide purchasing. She hopes to expand her cassava business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees, and fertilizer and pesticide purchasing

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and a single mother of four children.  She has been running a dry cleaning business for 14 years with a monthly income of KES 35, 000.

She has applied for a loan of KES.60, 000 through which she will be able to buy detergent for dry cleaning and also yarn for making sweaters. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

She will use her anticipate profits to educate her children. She hopes that her family and business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy detergent for dry cleaning and yarn for making sweaters

loans.name: Dolorfey

texts.en: Dolorfey manages a motorcycle transportation service and rental business for a living.  She has been doing this for a year, allowing her to earn an income aside from the salary of her husband who works as a pastor.  Her previous loan was used for spare parts and was successfully repaid with her income from this business. To purchase new tires, she is now requesting a new loan again from GDMPC micro credit. She plans to acquire another unit to expand her transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her motorcycle transport service

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Arlin is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Arlin has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Queen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Queen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Yadira

texts.es: Vilma de 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en cultivo de chiles y hace 5 años decidio cultivar café el cual vende en grano en el mercado local. El préstamo es por 7,000 lempiras con el cual va pagar mano de obra para limpieza y para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para mejorar la producción del café. Su plan es seguir cosechando café para mejorar la situación económica de la familia.
texts.en: 33-year-old Vilma lives in a common-law marriage with her husband, with whom she has three children. She lives in a small village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has always made a living from agriculture by growing chili peppers, and five years ago she decided to grow coffee, which she sells as beans at the local market. The loan is for 7,000 lempiras, which she will use to pay for labour for cleaning and to buy fertilisers and compost to improve her coffee production. Her plan is to continue harvesting coffee in order to improve her family’s economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, compost, and cleaners to improve her coffee production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Aura Del Carmen

texts.es: Aura tiene 59 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4  ya son independientes y el menor de 24 años vive en una ciudad donde puede transportarse a la universidad,  Aura vive sola en su casa que le dio el gobierno ecuatoriano, ella vive en el campo y se dedica a la ganadería desde que era una adolecerte, comenta que toda su vida a  mantenido a sus hijos mediante la crianza de animales, con el crédito va a comprar una vaca para seguir adelante con su negocio de ordeño de leche, ella aspira lograr comprar un terreno para ya no pagar arriendo por la hierba de sus vacas y que sus ingresos le alcancen   para que su hijo saque un título universitario.
texts.en: Aura is 59 years old. She is a single mother. She has five children, four of whom are independent. The youngest, at 24 years of age, lives in a city where he can travel to university. Aura lives alone in the house given to her by the Ecuadorian government. She lives in the country and has made a living by raising livestock since she was an adolescent. She says that for her whole life she has looked after her children through this work. She is going to buy a cow with the loan in order to continue with her milking business. She aspires to buy a plot of land so she does not have to pay rent for the grass for her cows and so that her earnings will be enough for her son to get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Teyvor's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Teyvor is 55 years old and a married mother blessed with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a local farmer who grows cassava as the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for 37 years.

This is the fourth loan for Teyvor with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and they have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle and, especially, to keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she is getting a new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay plowing and harvesting fees for her cassava farmland. She hopes her cassava business will enable her to buy a paddy of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay plowing and harvesting fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is a resident from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, and she is 28 years old. She also is a mother of two schooling kids. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava, and sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. She has been engaged in her current business for eight years, and she can earn income of 26,600 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. She is planning to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland. She strongly hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan is a villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and is a 64 year old mother of five children. The main source for her to earn income is from cassava farming which she has done for 46 years and it has given her a decent income. She has borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loan cycles. Now, her condition of living is getting better and it has enabled her to sufficiently provide food for her kids. For this cycle, she is leading a group of two for a new loan. She is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide and fertilizer as well as to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees. She strongly hopes her cassava will grow healthily and sell for a good price so she can expand her farm.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and fertilizer as well as to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es: Raymunda tiene tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su  hija y su nieta. Raymunda se gana la vida por medio de la compra y venta de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz y maicillo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Raymunda solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un muro de retención dado que su terreno se esta lavando y antes que el invierno empiece desea hacer la construcción lo antes posible. El monto solicitado lo usará para compra materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, piedra y hierro.
texts.en: Raymunda is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter and her granddaughter. Raymunda earns a living by buying and selling staple grains, such as maize, beans, rice, and sorghum. She is a very hard-working woman who does everything she can to give her family better living conditions. Raymunda is requesting this loan from FUSAI since she wishes to build a retaining wall as her land is washing away. She wants to build the wall as soon as possible as winter is coming. She will use the requested amount to buy materials, such as bricks, cement, sand, stones, and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, stones, and iron for building a retaining wall

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
A hardworking young girl two years ago began her business. She sews national women's dresses. Dilnoza tries to sew dresses with the new fashion. She has a rich imagination and realizes it in her sewing deal. She provides services to her clients in her house. Her parents support her to develop this business. 

Dilnoza wants to develop her business. She needs an embroidery machine for it. Many sewers have their embroidery machines and service in a wide sphere. She is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 32 years old. He is married and has been blessed with one child. He also has two adult dependants. He has been running his business for 11 years now. 

He currently makes an estimated monthly income of 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). He would like a loan of 30,000 KES, through which he will buy materials in bulk to make dresses for his customers. 

He will use his profits to repay his loan, and in the future, he dreams of becoming a successful designer and building a residential home.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old and supports eight people. He is married and together they have been blessed with three children. He has been running his general store for nine years now, and his wife also brings in some additional income. 

He would like to expand his business and so he is asking for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy more goods like sugar, rice and tea leaves to sell to clients in his area. He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 28,000, and he has successfully repaid all his previous loans.

He will use his anticipated profits to start a bigger business and to pay for a good education for his children. In the future, he hopes and dreams of having a bigger business in his own premises, and a happy family.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying more goods like salt, sugar, tea leaves and home products

loans.name: Ralhp

texts.en:
Ralhp is married with two children. He operates a service-based business providing transportation in his community to make a living. His wife is selling grocery goods in their own general store, and they earn well for the family. 

He is aiming to improve his business to sustain their daily needs. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to cover the costs for motor maintenance.  He plans to improve his business by having another unit of motorcycle for rental and transportation services. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes is 29 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two children. She also has three adult dependants. She has been running her business for 10 years now.  

She currently makes a monthly income of 30,500 KES (Kenyan shillings). She would like a loan of 33,000 KES to add more stock for her general store like sugar, wheat flour, bread and rice, so as to sell to customers in her area. 

She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. Through her anticipated profits, she will expand her general store. In the future, she hopes to have a stable income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy goods like sugar, wheat flour, rice, milk and bread

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Arlin is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita works hard to support her family. Benita is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Benita requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Benita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Benita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Arleene

texts.en:
Arleene is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Arleene works very hard to provide for them.

Arleene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arleene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Arleene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon is 59 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, where her cassava and rice are growing. She has been involved with this business for 19 years, and it has returned her 39,700 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the second loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of a group of two for the loan. For Samon, she has completely paid back her past loan successfully, and it had a positive impact in her household. She and her co-borrower are requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR and 1,500,000 KHR, respectively. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland. She hopes to collect a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 36, is a resident from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, and she is a married mother of four kids. To struggle for a living, she is growing cassava as the main source of income, and she also works as a paid worker for supplementary income. She has been with this business for ages, and it has earned her 31,900 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one past loan that was fully repaid and enabled her to upgrade her standard of living, better than before. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes to gain better cassava than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron is one of the affected areas in the Philippines when typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. She is 38 years old, and she is married to Allan who is a businessman. She has four children and two of them are already in school. A few months after the typhoon, Grace’s business is continuously recovering, and she and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Grace operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and she sells them with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 20,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy home appliances like televisions, speakers, and music players needed in her business.

Grace hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for home appliances like televisions, speakers, and music players needed in her business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn is 36 years old and a villager from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with six children; currently three of whom are in school and the three remaining are too young for schooling. 

To make a living, she does rice farming as her main source of income and she also earns extra income via cassava and bean farming. She has been involved with this business for 12 years, and it has returned her with a decent income. 

She is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the borrower in this cycle, she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her cassava fields. She highly hopes to gain better yields than before, and she hopes this current business will enable her to buy a cow to support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Amadou est un de nos clients du guichet de l’IMCEC qui se situe au croisement sur la route allant vers la capitale. Il est marié et papa de deux garçons de 5 ans et d’1 an et demi. Amadou a obtenu son permis en 2004 mais apprenait déjà à conduire un an auparavant. Il possède un camion qui transporte des chargements de sable. Avec ce crédit, il veut réparer son véhicule. Amadou est actif durant toute la journée : il peut démarrer sa journée à 3 h du matin quand la clientèle est là, comme il peut rester toute une journée sans voir de clients. Amadou participe à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et prend en charge la nourriture de ses apprentis, paie aussi le loyer.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés et mis de coté, il veut un jour augmenter le nombre de ses véhicules. Il désire aussi développer son commerce de vente de terrains.
texts.en:
Amadou is a client of the field partner UIMCEC, which is based at a crossroads on the road towards the capital city.  He is married and has two sons, aged five years old and eighteen months old.  Amadou obtained his driving licence in 2004 but had already been driving for a year before that.  He owns a truck which he uses to transport loads of sand.

Amadou plans to use his loan to repair his truck.  He works all day long, and can start as early as three in the morning.  However, some days he doesn't get any clients at all.

Amadou contributes to the day-to-day expenses of his family, pays for food for his apprentices and pays the rent.  He is currently saving some of the profits from his business and intends to use this in the future to increase the number of vehicles he owns.  He would also like to develop his land sales business.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Niièta ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Bamako-Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (concombres), habits et œufs                                                                 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nessa (femme debout en 1ére position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes, (concombres).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de concombre à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Bamako-Coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nessa compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the Nieta Group are all married, either in monogamous or polygamous families.  They are, on average, 36 years old and have four children.  The women live in Bamako-Coura, a neighbourhood of Bamako, and know one another through working at the market in Bamako-Coura, and through neighbourhood ties.

The Nieta Group sell vegetables (cucumbers), clothes and eggs.  The women would all like to improve their businesses so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Nessa (standing on the far right in the photo) sells vegetables (cucumbers).  She plans to use her loan to buy thirty sacks of cucumbers in Bamaka.  She will then sell them in Bamako-Coura to customers who are mainly women.

Nessa expects to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, and she will use this to reinvest in her business and contribute to the expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cucumbers) for resale.

loans.name: Filadelfia Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Filadelfia” conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras y  responsables que por medio de sus negocios buscan mejorar cada día. Alexandra de 34 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos en etapa escolar. Siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre ya que también se dedicaba a dicha actividad Alexandra decide iniciar su propio negocio de la venta de comida rápida como alita broster, hamburguesas y tortas.  Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo  puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es de poner una bodega, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevo y leche. El grupo “Filadelfia” agradecen el crédito brindado. Alexandra se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo de color verde.
texts.en:
This is the Communal bank "Philadelphia" made up of six responsible women workers, who use their businesses to try to improve their situation each day. 

Alexandra, 34, is married and has three children of school age. Following in the footsteps of her mother, who also worked in the same line of business, Alexandra decided to start her own business, selling fast-food such as fried chicken wings, hamburgers and cakes.  

She feels proud because thanks to her hard work, she can provide support with the household expenses. 

Her greatest desire is to set up a grocery store because she thinks this will earn her bigger profits. She will use the loan to buy flour, butter, eggs and milk. 

The group "Philadelphia" appreciate the help provided. Alexandra is at the back, second from the left, wearing a green polo.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Gamou

texts.fr:
Gamou est une dame de 54 ans qui a vécu pendant 12 ans en Sierra Léone. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon âgé de 30 ans et le benjamin, 18 ans. Rentrée au Sénégal, elle a continué ses activités commerciales démarrées depuis plus de 19 ans. Elle ouvre alors deux cantines, l’une qu’elle charge de vaisselles, l’autre, de tissus. Elle travaille de 9 du matin à 21h. Elle sollicite pour la sixième fois, un crédit pour renforcer la cantine de tissus mais aussi de vaisselle qui a été dévalisées récemment. Gamou est une femme très active qui a le sens de la famille, car elle a aussi lancé sa fille dans l’activité de coiffure, en lui ouvrant un salon. Pourtant, Gamou n’a plus de charges car c’est ses enfants qui s’occupent de la dépense quotidienne.
Les crédits ont un impact positive sur elle, ils lui ont permis de diversifier les produits et services, d’élargir le nombre d’employés en ouvrant des cantines.
Gamou désire acheter un véhicule et ouvrir d’autres magasins.
texts.en:
Gamou is 54 years old and lived for twelve years in Sierra Leone.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest child, a boy, is thirty years old, and the youngest is eighteen years old. 

Now re-established in Senegal, Gamou has continued with the business she started nineteen years ago.  She has two shops, one sells dishes and the other one sells fabric.  She works from nine in the morning until nine at night.  This will be Gamou's sixth loan and she will use it to buy stock for her fabric shop, and also to buy dishes to replace those that were stolen from her shop recently.

Gamou is a very active business woman, who works hard for her family.  She has established a hairdressing salon for her daughter.  Gamou no longer has to provide for the day-to-day expenses of her household as her children have assumed responsibility for this.  Her loans have a positive impact on her position as they have allowed her to diversify the range of products and services which she offers.  They have also enabled her to provide employment for more people by opening other shops.

In the future, Gamou would like to buy a vehicle and open further shops.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), lace and fabric for men's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Irma Gladys

texts.es:
La socia Irma Gladys se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia tambien estudia administracion de empresas en la universidad, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The group member Irma Gladys is in the business of selling beauty products.  She is also studying business administration at the University.  

She sells lip-sticks, creams and perfumes.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  She already has several years experience in this business.  

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products.  

She is asking for a loan to buy creams, lip-sticks and perfumes.

She is happy with the loan system and is committed to meeting the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lip-stick and perfume.

loans.name: Lorena Rosa

texts.es: Lorena, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando frijol, y hace 7 años comenzó a cultivar café, el cual vende en pergamino húmedo y seco. Solicita un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y para limpiar el cultivo mejorando así las condiciones del cultivo. Tiene como plan seguir produciendo café para mejorar su situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena, 22, lives with her husband and their son.  She lives in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. 

She has always devoted her time to agriculture, cultivating beans.  Seven years ago she also began to grow coffee, which she sells both wet and dry. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer to clean the crop and improve its condition. She plans to continue producing coffee to improve the economic stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to clean the coffee crops.

loans.name: Enma Lucila

texts.es: Enma vive en La Gruta de la Paz que es un lugar turístico, se dedica desde que era niña juntamente con su madre  a la venta de comida casera en un kiosco, y tiene una chica a la que le paga para que le ayude a servir a sus clientes,  Enma tiene 53 años de edad, tiene  3 hijos que ya son independientes debido a la buena educación que les dio Enma y su esposo, esta señora trabajadora vende los fines de semana sus alimentos y  los demás días se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería juntamente con su esposo, Enma va a invertir su crédito en la compra de productor para prepararlos,  lo que Enma espera es  que su negocio siga surgiendo para poder hacer acomodar su casa ya que está en mal estado y que con estos temblores que está ocurriendo en el Ecuador teme que se le caiga su casita
texts.en:
Enma, 53, lives in La Gruta de la Paz, which is a tourist resort.  Since she was a little girl working with her mother, she has dedicated her time to the sale of home-cooked meals in a kiosk.  She has a girl who she pays to help her serve the customers.  

She has three children who are already living independently thanks to the wonderful upbringing that they received from Enma and her husband.  

As a hard-working woman, she sells her food at the weekends and the rest of the week she works in agriculture; raising cattle together with her husband.  

Emma is going to invest the loan in products to prepare her food.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can make improvements to her home which is in a poor condition.  She fears that with the tremors they are experiencing lately in Ecuador, her house is going to fall down.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Don Paulino de 49 años de edad, soltero, tiene tres hijos, vive en una aldea de Ilama, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, realizaba trabajos de jornal y hace 18 años realiza su propio cultivo, cultiva café y banano el cual vende en el mercado de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 22,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar su finca existente y sembrar una manzana mas de café. Su propósito es mejorar la producción y aumentar el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paulino, 49, is unmarried and has three children.  He lives in a village in Ilama, Santa Barbara. He has always worked in agriculture.  He works as a laborer and for 18 years he has looked after his own crops.  He grows coffee and bananas which he sells in the local market. 

He is asking for a loan of 22,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and compost for his fields and to sow another block of coffee seeds. 

His aim is to improve production and build up a bigger inheritance for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his plot of land and to sow coffee seeds in an extra space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan es un joven agricultor de 19 años que toda su vida se ha dedicado a los pesados trabajos del campo para conseguir el sustento para su hogar.
Es soltero y vela por el cuidado de sus padres y hermanos.
Tiene un pequeño cultivo de variados alimentos como tomate, yuca y algunas fresas en un terreno prestado por un conocido.
Tiene grandes planes para su futuro como estudiar y capacitarse en varias áreas y tener un negocio que le permita lograr una estabilidad económica razonable.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar semillas de habichuela y nutrir su variedad de alimentos, además desea comprar insumos para trabajar su tierra como abonos y riegos.
Con estos elementos podrá seguir trabajando hasta que pueda cumplir su gran sueño de tener una gran parcela propia y tener ingresos independientes.
texts.en:
Juan is a young 19-year-old farmer who has worked all his life in agriculture, doing hard work to earn an income to support his home.

He is single and works long hours to look after his parents and siblings.

He has a small crop of varied foods such as tomato, yucca and some strawberries on a plot of land that he has borrowed from a friend.

He has big plans for their future, such as studying and training in various sectors, and having a business that allows him to achieve some sort of economic stability.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds for beans and nurture his variety of crops.  In addition, he wants to buy supplies for his land such as fertilizer and products for irrigation.

These things will allow him to continue working so he can fulfil his ultimate dream of having a large plot of his own and having his own income for himself.

loans.use: to buy seeds for beans and supplies for fertilizing and watering.

loans.name: Lilian Margoth

texts.es: Liliana es madre soltera, ella tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 años que asiste a la escuela y una de 10 años que es discapacitada ya que no puede hablar y que empezó a caminar a los 5 años, Liliana le lleva constantemente a su hija a las terapias a las que tiene que asistir la niña, Liliana vive con sus dos hijos en una casa que le dio el bono de un programa  de su país, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, ella aspira incrementar su negocio para que sus ingresos le permitan seguir luchando contra la enfermedad de su hija.
texts.en:
Liliana is a single mother.  She has two children; one aged 12 who goes to school and one aged ten who has a disability because she can't talk and only started to walk when she was five.  Liliana always takes her daughter to the therapy sessions she has to go to.  

Liliana lives with her two children in a house that she was given through a welfare programme in her country.   

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs; a business she has worked in already for ten years.  She hopes to increase her business so that her income will allow her to continue to cope with her daughter's illness.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 30 años de edad,  es licenciada en administración de empresas,esta  acompañada, su compañera de vida se dedica a panificador, por ahorita viven en casa solo los dos.


Ella trabaja en el hospital nacional, ya tiene seis meses,el empleo lo adquirió por medio de plaza, ella apoya a su esposo en elaborar el pan.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar un horno para elaborar pan,  ya que el que tenían ya no tiene reparación.  El  préstamo cubrirá la necesidad de comprar el horno y de esa forma la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El objetivo de la cliente y de su esposo es seguir con su negocio y tener mas clientes y de esa forma obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 30, is a graduate in business administration.  Her husband is a baker.  For now, just the two of them live in their house.

She has been working in the national hospital for six months.  She also helps her husband make bread.

She is going to use the loan to buy an oven for bread, because the one they have now is beyond repair.  The loan will cover the need to buy the oven.

Together, their aim is to continue in business and win more customers which will in turn get them more profit.

loans.use: to buy an oven for making bread.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: A sus  74 años de edad Teresa se dedica unos 40 años a la venta de comidas caseras en un lugar que es muy visitado por turistas  ya que hay una Gruta donde apareció la que la denominaron La Virgen de la Paz, debido a que muchas personas visitan este lugar el negocio de Teresa es muy bueno porque muchas personas le compran la comida  que ella prepara, Teresa tiene contratado una chica para que le ayude en la atención a sus clientes, Teresa es viuda y  vive sola ya que sus   8  hijos ya son casados, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su comida,  lo que aspira  Teresa es mejorar su negocio y adecuarlo para que sea más llamativo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
At the age of 74 Teresa has spent some 40 years selling home-cooked food in a place which is visited by a lot of tourists, because there is a Grotto where the so-called Virgen de la Paz appeared. Since a lot of people visit this place, Teresa's business is very good because a lot of people buy the food she makes.

Teresa employs a girl to help her to serve her customers. Teresa is a widow and lives alone now that her 8 children are all married.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food. Her aspiration is to improve her business and refurbish it to make it more attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Don Bosco-Quebrada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DON BOSCO-QUEBRADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanatile, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos,mandarinas,papayas y naranjas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva estas frutas, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “DON BOSCO-QUEBRADA” communal bank, which is located in the district of Yanatile, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Lucia, who is a member, is 46 years old and lives with her partner. She has a business selling fruit. She sells bananas, mandarins, papayas and oranges. She has a plot of land where she grows the fruit, and she has a market stall where she sells her produce. She works from 8am until 5pm. She has had the business for 7 years now and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her fruit. 

She is asking for the loan to buy seed and fertilizers for the land she cultivates. 

The other members have businesses selling coffee, selling fruit, selling food, and a grocery shop.

Lucia is grateful to those who play a part in her dream through this process and promises to meet her payments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es: Dinora, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive con su hermano y su hijo en una aldea que pertenece a Ilama, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 3 años de cultivar café, banano y también produce leche de vaca.  Su producción y la leche la vende en su casa y en el mercado local. El préstamo es por 22,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para abonar su finca de café y sembrar 500 plantas de banano con el fin de mejorar la producción e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora is 23 years old and is a single mother with a son. She lives with her brother and her son in a village which belongs to Ilama, Santa Bárbara. For 3 years she has been growing coffee and bananas and she also produces cows' milk. She sells her crops and the milk from her home and in the local market.

The loan of 22,000 lempiras is to buy fertilizers to fertilize her coffee farm and to plant 500 banana plants with the aim of improving her yield and increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm and plant 500 banana plants.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Soutoura sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro Dounfing l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de copinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sirakoro Dounfing. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes), ustensiles, condiments et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600 paires de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges  à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait à Sirakoro Dounfing à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The six women in the Soutoura Group are all married, most of them in monogamous families.  They are, on average, 37 years old and have four children.  They live in Sirakoro Dounfing, a neighbourhood of Bamako.  The women know one another through working at the Sirakoro Dounfing market, and friendship, neighbourhood and family ties.

The members of this group sell plastic shoes (for men and women), kitchen utensils, condiments and cosmetic products.  In order to build up their stock levels, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Fatoumata (standing on the far right of the photo) is well-known for selling plastic shoes (for men and women).  She plans to use her loan to buy 600 pairs of plastic shoes for all ages, from wholesalers in Bamako.  She will resell them in Sirakoro Dounfing, to mainly women customers.  Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay for healthcare costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, no estudio, esta casada,  su esposo trabaja de jornalero, dos hijos van a la escuela los otros dos hijos trabajan.

 El negocio que posee María es de tortilleria, desde  hace 19  años, lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de crecer a su hijos darles lo necesario para que estudien y puedan ganarse la vida por si solos, el horario de su negocio de tortillas es de 4:AM a 9:AM , todos los días de lunes a domingo.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz,leña,comprar por mayor para que de esa forma le salga mas barato y la necesidad quedara satisfecha porque tendrá lo necesario para su vida y la de su familia.

El sueño de la cliente es mantener su negocio y  obtener mas ingresos de esa forma podrá  su familia vivir mejor y seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and has had no education. She is married and her husband works as a labourer. Two children go to school and the other two are working. 

María has a business making tortillas and has done this for 19 years.  She learnt this out of the necessity to bring her children up and give them what they needed so they could have an education and be able to make a living on their own.

She works in her tortilla business from 4am to 9am every day from Monday to Sunday.

She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood which she will buy wholesale so that it works out cheaper. This will meet her needs as she will have everything she needs for her own life and her family's.

María's dream is to keep her business going and to make more income so her family can live better. She wants to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es la más joven de una asociación de mujeres que se dedican a vender comida en kioscos que están ubicados en un lugar que es muy visitado por tener atractivos turísticos, Ella  es la encargada de hacer los trámites   para solicitar al gobierno local las ayudas para la adecuación de sus pequeños kioscos y que hasta ahora han logrado poner viseras y poner cemento en los pisos que eran de tierra y que cuando llovía se hacía lodo y esto hacia que menoren sus ventas,  Ana comenta que desde que estaba en la escuela le ayudaba a su madre en este negocio y  que el fallecer su madre Ana siguió adelante con esta actividad, Ana es madre soltera y vive con su padre y sus 2 hijos que están estudiando, Ana va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos para venderlos ya preparados, a Ana le encantaría poder comprar unas cocinas bien lindas,  y junto a sus compañeras seguir acomodando los kioscos poco a poco hasta que sean bien presentables.
texts.en: Ana is the youngest member of a women's association. They work selling food in kiosks located in a place that is much frequented because it has tourist attractions. She is in charge of the paperwork to ask the local government for help fixing up their little kiosks and so far they have been able to put on awnings and cement floors to replace the dirt floors they had previously. When it rained everything used to get muddy and this would diminish their sales. Ana says that since she was in elementary school she would help her mother in this business and when her mother died Ana kept doing the activity. Ana is a single mother and she lives with her father and her 2 children, who are in school. Ana is going to invest the loan in buying products to sell that are already prepared. Ana would love to buy some really nice stoves and with the other members continue to improve the kiosks little by little so they can be very presentable.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio, de 62 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos, y vive en Santa Barbara. En su casa tiene un pequeño taller de reparación y mantenimiento de herramientas y maquinaria eléctrica, desde joven ha realizado esta actividad, lleva aproximadamente 35 años. Ha solicitado el segundo préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar repuestos y accesorios para surtir su taller y ofrecer mejor servicio, con los repuestos va reparar los aparatos eléctricos a sus clientes. Su propósito es mantener siempre su taller y tenerlo surtido de repuestos.
texts.en:
Don Julio is 62 years old and lives in a common-law union with his partner. They have two children and live in Santa Barbara. In his house he has a small workshop for repairing and maintaining tools and electronic equipment. He has carried out this trade for around 35 years, since he was young.

He has applied for a second loan of 15,000 Lempiras to buy spare parts and accessories to stock up his workshop and offer a better service. He will use the spare parts to repair his clients' electronic appliances. His aim is to always maintain his workshop and have it stocked up with spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories to stock up his workshop and offer a better service.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne  34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (basins) de toutes les qualités, de produits cosmétiques et  d’huiles d’arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé  de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme assise en 3ème position  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (bazins, pagnes wax, légers,...).Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20mètres de bazins à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Rokia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is made up only of women who live in monogamous relationships. They have an average age of 34 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the districts in Bamako, and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. The group members are small retailers of cloth (damask) of mixed quality, beauty products and groundnut oils. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their first group loan cycle.

Rokia (the woman sitting in the middle in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of cloth (including damask, light fabrics and wax pagnes, a highly colourful and decorative type of West African cloth). She plans to use her loan to buy 20 metres of damask cloth in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and on the streets to a varied retail clientèle. Thanks to this loan, Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business. Her aim is to buy a plot of residential land thanks to her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy damask fabric of the highest quality.

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Mougnou ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (échalotes et gombo), pâtes d’arachides, légumes, draps et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter  leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Korotoumou (femme  assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (échalotes et gombo). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   12 kg d’échalotes et  10 kg de gombo en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Korotoumou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in monogamous households, the 6 members of the Mougnou group have an average age of 37 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities at the Djalakorodji market. The group members are small retailers of condiments (shallots and okra), groundnut paste, vegetables, sheets and clothing. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their first group loan cycle.

Korotoumou (the woman sitting in the middle of the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of condiments (shallots and okra). She plans to use her loan to buy 12 kilos of shallots and 10 kilos of okra wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales on the streets of Djalakorodji to a retail clientèle made up mostly of women. Thanks to this loan, Korotoumou expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to take care of the small household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a 24-year-old single woman and a university graduate. At first, she faced many difficulties in finding work after graduating from the university, but then she found a job with a car company. She's been working in the sales department for six months. 

Nadine is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay what is left from the price of the car she bought. The car is necessary for her transportation to work.

She hopes to develop her career at her company and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay what is left from the price of the car she bought.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban-Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, du pain, des condiments, du jus,   des produits cosmétiques et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assan (femme  assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako en gros.  La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Kalaban-Coura et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Assan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The five women of the Yiriwa group are married and mostly live in monogamous households. They have an average age of 34 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities at the Kalaban-Coura market. The group members are small retailers of clothing, bread, condiments, juices, beauty products and prepared food. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their second group loan cycle.

Assan (the woman sitting second from the left in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She plans to use her loan to buy 50 wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash or credit in Kalaban-Coura and on the streets to a clientèle made up mostly of women. Thanks to this loan, Assan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 110 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to take care of her children in the household.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with four children who lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. He sells sodas, beers and spirits. He obtains additional income from a banana plantation business. He experiences low levels of customers. His vision is to build a personal house using the proceeds from his business. Julius needs the loan to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Bamwe Group

texts.en: Eunice is twenty-six, a member of Bamwe group, and a mother of two school-going children. Eunice dropped out of school and got married at the early age of nineteen. Being a businessman, her husband encouraged her to begin a business, so in 2011 she began a business supplying general merchandise to different supermarkets and shops within Kampala. She believes her business is doing well. The aim of the business is to supplement the earnings of her husband so they can look after their family. Eunice approached UGAFODE for a group loan to boost her business. With her portion of the loan, she will buy more stocks of flour. She is very hard working, trustworthy and focused. She thanks the group members and Kiva lenders for a job well done. Eunice is second from the left in the photograph with her hand raised.

loans.use: To buy stocks of corn flour to supply to supermarkets

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is twenty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with one child. She also has one adult dependent. She has been running her business for five years now.

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 40,000. She would like a loan of KES 40,500 in order to buy more stocks of items like salt, sugar and tea leaves for her general store. She sells these items to clients in her area.

She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She will use her anticipated profits to expand her business. In future, she wishes to become successful.

loans.use: to buy goods like salt, sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en: Ebtisam is a widow who was left with her two sons and only daughter. One of her sons is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his third year. He is planning to support his family after graduation by looking for a good job in his major. Ebtisam doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Zoila Victoria

texts.es: Zoila tiene 73 años, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos la primera tiene 52 años y el otro tiene 48 años de edad, de los cuales la hija mayor sufre una discapacidad, Zoila vende comida como almuerzos, sopa de pata de chancho, sopa de pollo, fritada, choclos con queso, habas,  empanadas con café entre otros que se les considera platos típicos de este lugar   y por eso son muy consumidos por los turistas y personas de los alrededores que vicitan este lugar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para prepararlos y ofrecerlos en su puesto de comidas, lo que Zoila aspira es lograr mejorar  su negocio y seguir adelante ayudándose en los gastos de su hija.
texts.en: Zoila is 73 years old. She is the single mother of 2 children. The oldest is 52 and the other one is 48 years old. Her oldest daughter is handicapped. Zoila sells food, such as lunches, pork foot soup, chicken soup, corn and cheese, lima beans, empanadas and coffee, and more traditional dishes of the area. That is why they are very popular with the tourists and people from nearby who visit the area. She is going to invest the loan in buying products to prepare and offer for sale in her food stall. What Zoila aspires to is being able to improve her business and keep going forward, helping with her daughter's expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La  señora María, tiene 33 años y tres hijos de 5, 11 y 13 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de pescado frito desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esta actividad, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de la Ceja de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora María va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración del pescado como chuño, papa y maíz al por mayor y tambien compra de material de construccion para la refaccion d su vivienda, la señora María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar en su negocio como tambien ayudarle a brindar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: María is 33 years old and has three children, aged 5, 11 and 13. She has worked selling fried fish for a long time. She sells from her stall located in an area in the outskirts of El Alto. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. María is going to use this loan to buy ingredients to prepare the fish, such as chuño, potatoes and corn wholesale. She will also buy construction materials to repair her home. María faces challenges in her business, such as competition. There are a lot of places in the area that sell food. She is going to use the profits to keep buying ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity that is being offered to her to improve her business and also offer comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare fish and to make home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María tiene 71 años de edad, ella es divorciada y  vive sola ya que sus 2 hijas ya son casadas, comenta que se dedica 48 años a vender comida en un kiosco  que está ubicado en  un lugar muy visitado por las personas ya que es un lugar donde existe piscinas y un santuario, María tiene una chica a la que le paga para que le ayude los fines de semana a atender a los clientes que llegan a su puesto de venta,   el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para  vender su comida, la aspiración de María es mejorar su negocio para ayudarse en sus gastos.
texts.en:
María is 71 years old, divorced and lives alone as her two daughters are already married. She has worked for 48 years selling food in a kiosk located in an area visited by a lot of people due to the swimming pools and sanctuary there. María pays a girl to help her serve the clients that come to the kiosk at the weekend. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of products in order to sell her food. María's dream is to improve her business in order to help with her expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Dambae district of the Kampong Cham province, Khon is 47 years old and a mother of four children. Nowadays, only three of the children rely on her and are still in school. To overcome her financial burden, Khon does cassava farming as the main source of her income and she also earns additional income from pig-raising. She has been with this business for 29 years and she earns a decent income that she uses to support her family. This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Khon is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for plowing and harvesting of her farmland. Khon hopes this business will enable her to buy a paddy field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay for plowing and harvesting of her farmland.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bertha se  dedica al negocio de  verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Bertha makes a living selling vegetables. She takes them to different places and sells onions, tomatoes and squashes. She has had this business for several years now and it is going very well for her. Bertha's dream is to have an outlet where she can sell the vegetables.

She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes. She is happy about the loan and promises to pay her instalments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
