Juana, sigue buscando la forma de salir adelante y mantener su negocio activo, por lo que se decidió a solicitar más capital para comprar aceite, sal, condimentos, harina, chicharrón, quesillo, verduras, bebidas, laminas, alambre, clavos y madera, tendrá todo lo necesario para la elaboración de pupusas y antojitos, por la época de lluvias que se acerca construirá un pequeño local para que sus clientes estén mucho más cómodos.
El estilo de vida que su familia tiene actualmente es más confortable, ha logrado mantener su negocio en el mercado con la ayuda de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Juana continues to look for a way of getting on in life and keeping her business going. This is why she decided to ask for more capital to buy oil, salt, seasoning, flour, pork rind, fresh cheese, vegetables, drinks, sheeting, wire, nails and wood. This will give her everything she needs for making pupusas (traditional dish made of corn tortilla) and snacks, and for the approaching rainy season she plans to build a small place to make her customers much more comfortable.

Her family now has a more comfortable lifestyle. She has been able to keep her business going with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, seasoning, flour, pork rind, fresh cheese, vegetables, drinks, sheeting, wire, nails and wood.

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer extremadamente emprendedora y muy guerrera.
Desde que se separo del hombre que era su esposo se hizo cargo de todas las obligaciones del hogar y quedo al cuidado de sus dos hijos en ese entonces menores de edad.
Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 14 años, con la que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con todo el coraje que solo una madre soltera puede tener.
Tiene grandes planes para el futuro de su negocio y su familia, por eso lucha día a día para alcanzar ese sueño de tener una vida prospera y tranquila.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta y realizar domicilios a sus clientes. De esta forma podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio y aumentará significativamente sus ventas viéndose reflejado positivamente en sus ingresos.
Sus hijos ya son mayores pero no ha cambiado nunca el amor y el cuidado que les brinda.
texts.en:
Luz is an extremely enterprising and determined woman. After she separated from her ex-husband, she took over all the household duties and was left to care for her two children who were, at that time, minors. She has had a grocery store for 14 years. This has enabled her to bring up her children with all the courage that only a single mother can have.

She has big plans for the future of her business and her family, this is why she struggles every day to achieve her dream of a peaceful and prosperous life.

She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle and make home deliveries to her customers. In this way she can provide a better service, increase her sales significantly and see this reflect positively in her income.

Her children are now adults but she has never changed the love and care that she gives them.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike in order to make home deliveries

loans.name: Merly Necida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CUMPLIDITOS DE RIOBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Yanatile y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Merly Necida se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia vende maiz,cacao y quinua,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cacao,maiz y quinua.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Merly Necida is a member of the “LOS CUMPLIDITOS DE RIOBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Yanatile and the department of Cusco. 

Merly Necida makes a living selling cereals. She sells corn, cocoa and quinoa. She works from 8am until 5pm. She has had the business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have an outlet where she can sell the cereals.

Merly Necida is asking for the loan to buy cocoa, corn and quinoa. She is happy about the loan and promises to pay her instalments.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Maria Carmenza

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer valiente y nunca se ha rendido a pesar de vivir en una zona de peligro armado constantemente.
En efecto esta mujer tiene un taller de confección a terceros desde hace 6 años, lo monto gracias a la motivación que le daban sus hijos.
Esta actividad la aprendió luego de haber trabajado por muchos años en diferentes fábricas de confección.
Una de sus principales dificultades es que se encuentra ubicada en una zona peligrosa por el conflicto entre bandas criminales y esto ha hecho muy difícil su trabajo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar una maquina fileteadora que le hace falta para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene en estos momentos.
Con esta máquina podrá generar otro empleo a parte de los 3 que ya está ofreciendo.
Es una mujer guerrera y con gran sentido del humor ante los problemas.
texts.en:
Maria is a brave woman who has never given up despite living in a zone of constant armed conflict.

She has had a dressmaking workshop for third parties for 6 years. She set this up thanks to the motivation that her children gave her. She learned this trade from having worked for many years in different dressmaking factories.

One of the principal difficulties that she faces is that she is in a dangerous area, due to conflict between criminal gangs, and this has made her work very difficult.

She is currently applying for a loan in order to buy a serger machine, which she needs to carry out the orders that she has at the moment. With this machine she will be able to generate another post apart from the 3 that she is already offering. She is a woman who fights hard and with a great sense of humour in the face of problems.

loans.use: to buy a serger machine.

loans.name: Jubita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CUMPLIDITOS DE RIOBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Yanatile y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juvita se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jubita is a member of the “LOS CUMPLIDITOS DE RIOBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Yanatile and the department of Cusco.

Jubita has a business growing fruit. She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6am until 5pm. She has had the business for several years now and it is going well for her. Her dream is to extend the land she cultivates.

Jubita is asking for the loan to buy seed and fertilizers. She is happy about the loan and promises to pay her instalments.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yeison Antonio

texts.es:
La educación y el trabajo son pilares importantes en la vida de Yeison, quién a sus 17 años cursa quinto año de secundaria en modo sabatino y los días de semana labora en la venta de arena y realiza viajes en moto taxi a los barrios más cercanos al que pertenece. Es un joven emprendedor e inteligente, trabaja para brindar ayuda en la economía de su familia. Sus padres son su principal soporte, quienes día a día lo motivan a cumplir todas sus metas.
Yeison solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora portátil, la cual será una herramienta útil para el desarrollo de sus actividades escolares. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que le ayudará a buscar información y realizar trabajos en línea. La tecnología se ha convertido es uno de sus mejores aliados, para lograr destacarse en el campo de estudio y actividades laborales. Una de sus metas es culminar secundaría con buenas notas y lograr ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Education and work are important pillars in the life of Yeison, who at 17 years old is completing his fifth year of secondary school on the weekends.  On weekdays he works selling sand and making trips via mototaxi to the neighborhoods closest to his own.  He is an enterprising and intelligent young man.  He works in order to help his family financially.  His parents are his main support, encouraging him everyday to achieve all his goals.  

Yeison is asking for a loan to buy a portable computer, which will be a useful tool to carry out his schoolwork.  He has placed his confidence in this loan, because it will help him to search for information and do work online.  Technology has become one of his best allies, in order to stand out in his field of study and work.  One of his goals is to finish secondary school with good grades and enroll in the university.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Maria Rosario se dedica a enseñar pues es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad donde vive, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues va pagar los estudios de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario is a teacher.  She works in one of the schools of the city where she lives.  She is a responsible person, so they invited her to participate in the “Camino al Progreso” [Road to Progress] communal bank.

At this point in time, she needs a loan for personal use—to pay for her children’s schooling.  She is thankful for the loan and really values it.  She is committed to making her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's schooling

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio de 42 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, actualmente está acompañado han procreado tres hijos hasta el momento, los tres aun están pequeños,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, aunque a veces hace ventas en la casa.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace diez años, esto dice que lo aprendió de su padre que en su tiempo se dedicaba a esto, ya que no contaban con lo necesario para mantenerlos  y él fue aprendiendo y ahora que él tiene su hogar ha decidido dedicarse de lleno a la agricultura;  ya que dice que a final del  año sabe que cosechara lo que cultivo durante el año, el terreno donde cultiva le queda a diez minutos de su casa, así que se traslada caminando;  su esposa e hijos le colaboran cuando pueden y su horario es de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono para la siembra, y otros insumos que se utilizan para ello, aparte de eso dice que necesita ayudarle a su esposa con un gasto que ella tiene con una medicina. Con este préstamo considera que cubrirá los gastos que se le vienen ahorita,  que ya inicio el invierno y es cuando más necesita preparar terreno para la siembra.


Sus sueños son tener siempre buena salud para seguir cultivando y seguir cosechando para su familia, ya que quiere que sus hijos estudien para que no les toque como a él que por no haber podido estudiar le ha tocado pesado su vida.
texts.en:
Julio, age 42, went to school through the second grade.  He is in a relationship, and they have three children at this point.  All three are still little.  His wife takes care of the household chores, although at times she also makes sales from the house.

Julio has worked in agriculture for ten years.  He says he learned this from his father, who also did this type of work back in his day.  They didn’t have the money they needed to support themselves and he was learning.  Now that he has his own household he has decided to work full-time in farming.  He says that at the end of the year he knows that he will harvest what he has grown during the year.  The land he farms is ten minutes from his home, so he walks to work.  His daily schedule is from 7 a.m. until 4 p.m.  His wife and children help him when they can.

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to buy fertilizer for his cultivated fields, as well as other supplies that he uses on them.  Besides this, he says that he needs to help his wife with an expense that she has for a medicine.  With this loan he thinks he will cover the expenses that are coming up soon, for winter has already started and that is when he needs to prepare the land for sowing.

His dream is to always have good health so that he can keep on farming for his family.  He wants his children to go to school so that they don’t wind up like him, with life weighing heavily on him due to not being able to go to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for his cultivated land, as well as to help his wife with the cost of a medicine

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es: Dalia es una joven madre de un hijo, ella está buscando como superarse junto a su familia, se apoya económicamente gracias a su empleo como agente de ventas en una empresa textilera, está cursando los últimos módulos de su carrera de Ing. en Sistemas, razón por la que solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, siendo este uno de sus mayores sueños en la vida verse toda una profesional.
texts.en: Dalia is a young mother with one child. She is seeking ways to get ahead in life together with her family. She supports herself economically thanks to her job as a sales agent with a textile company. She is also currently taking her final courses for a degree in Systems Engineering. For this reason, she is requesting the loan to pay for the final course of study for her degree. This has been one of her greatest dreams in life: to see herself as a full professional.

loans.use: to pay for her final course of study.

loans.name: Giovana Mila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO DE ECHARATE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Giovana Mila se dedica al trabajo como emfermera,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO DE ECHARATE, or Together for the Development of Echarate. The bank is located in the district of Echarate belonging to the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

The member Giovana Mila works as a nurse for a living. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. The member already has some years in this business and it is going very well. The dream of the member is to have a store where she can sell clothing. The member is requesting the loan to buy a television for her house.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality chicken feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 1000 pineapple seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality chicken feeds and re-stock 40 layers

loans.name: Strive Ahead Group

texts.en:
Sithembiso is a 36 year old mother of 4. She is a married tenant and her husband is currently unemployed. She is in the business of knitting and selling jerseys.
She is a member of the Strive Ahead group; the group has been borrowing from Thrive for the past year. Sithembiso and Sharon are the remaining members as others have fallen away, their determination has ensured that they continue to strive ahead. Even though Sithembiso lost about $1000 to thieves in the last year, she has proudly repaid her loan as per reschedule.
A loan to this group will enable Sithembiso to knit enough jerseys to meet her demand as the winter season is just starting. Owing to climate change winters are getting colder in Zimbabwe and good business prospects await her.

loans.use: To buy wool to knit jumpers for sale.

loans.name: Maricela Yaneth

texts.es: Maricela tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 16 años y 5 años de edad. Maricela se gana al vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Maricela es caracterizada como una mujer responsable y trabajadora que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Hace unos meces dio inicio a la construcción de un muro en su vivienda el cual lo inicio con fondos provenientes de un financiamiento que recibió  de FUSAI. Nuevamente se acercó a la institución para solicitar otro financiamiento que le permita terminar el muro y así dar a su familia mayor seguridad. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo y arena.
texts.en: Maricela is 38 years old and lives in her own house together with her life partner and their three children ages 17, 16 and 5 years old. Maricela has been in domestic services for a living for some time. Maricela is known as a responsible and hardworking woman that makes the most of what she has to improve her family's living conditions. Some months ago she started the construction of a wall in her home which she started with funds provided by FUSAI. She is now approaching the institution to request another loan that will allow her to finish the wall and give her family greater security. With the amount requested, she will buy cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick, and sand to complete the construction of a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a permanent piggery shelter

loans.name: Mwari Anesu Group

texts.en:
Mwari Anesu is a group of women  that has received group dynamics and financial training from Thrive Microfinance. Patricia is one of the group members. She is a 28 year old lady, who is also a hard-worker who lives in Rugare, a high density suburb in Harare. 
Patricia is into sausage manufacturing, she however, does not have the infrastructure to sustain her operations. She rents a small room that she uses as a butchery, as well as the equipment to make the sausages. She has been doing this for the past three years but through the business management training she got, she now realises the need for her to own at least her own equipment as this will reduce her overheads and greatly improve her profits.
The members of this group are into different businesses and they all need a combined loan of USD2200 from Kiva to boost their businesses and realise better profits.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her sausage making business

loans.name: Lighthouse Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Lighthouse group. She is the one holding a stack of hats in the photograph. She is 46 years old and widowed. Maria is a cross border trader who is philanthropic in nature. She travels to Johannesburg, South Africa twice every month to purchase stock of hats, socks, scarfs, and other small items. She sells her stock in town at four different points. What is unique about her operation is that she employs only the disabled to sell at the other three points. She pays them every week, provides transport and lunch money. She also provides them with counseling and moral support.
Maria and her group need a loan of USD2150.00 so that they can boost their businesses and provide for their families as most of them are bread winners. The group has completed the Thrive training course and have evidently improved their business methods.

loans.use: to buy hats, socks, scarves and other items for resale

loans.name: Kuwadzana Group

texts.en:
Constance and her friend, Nyarai live in Highfields, Harare in Zimbabwe. The two are the remaining members of the Kuwadzana group. Constance is seated on the right side. She is a cross border trader who travels to South Africa, Botswana and Zambia buying new and second hand clothes for resale. She has gone through the training offered at Thrive and has benefitted from it as she now keeps good records that enable her to make informed business decisions.
Constance and her friend need a loan of $1,000 in order to boost their businesses and increase their profit margins. Her husband is an unskilled carpenter who gets jobs sporadically so he does not have a regular source of income. The money that Constance makes from her cross border trading helps with the family’s livelihood and it would be a great help if she got this loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and household items for sale.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is a 24-year-old married woman with one child. She started selling cosmetics from her house three years ago, but now she makes trips all around the city to client's homes. After facing the struggle of acquiring clients and building her reputation around the area, she is now well known by a number of friends and neighbors who seek the superb quality of products she provides. Her husband works as an officer, and despite both their incomes, they struggle to keep up with their family's increasing expenses.
 
Liliane is a previous borrower of Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua and the last loan she took out left a positive impact on her family. She is now acquiring a YOUTH loan to help settle her baby delivery fees so that she can continue focusing on growing her business.

loans.use: to help settle her baby delivery fees so that she can continue focusing on growing her business.

loans.name: Ingilab

texts.en:
Ingilab is a 34-year-old man. He has a lovely family: a wife and two sons. His wife is a housewife and helps Ingilab in their family business. His elder son goes to the seventh class of school and his little son also is going to the fifth class of school. The family members are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Baku region.

Ingilab has been in an animal breeding business. He buys little calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. Summer is coming and he wants to vaccinate his animals. Therefore he has requested a loan in the amount of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Ingilab is thankful to Kiva  and its lenders for this help. In the future he wants to start producing dairy products and selling them.

loans.use: to pay for vaccinating his animals

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO ECHARATI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención ,distrito de Echarate y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosario  tiene 54 años de edad y  es separada , la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de cafetería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez es profesora en uno de los colegios de la zona,, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio como tortas, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO ECHARATI communal bank, located in the La Convencion province in the Echarate district and Cusco department.

Rosario is 54 years old and separated.  She runs a café and has had this business for some time.  Things are going well for her in this business thanks to the dedication she puts in.  She is also a teacher in one of the area schools.  This is how she supports her family.

She needs this loan to buy supplies for her business, such as sandwiches, soft drinks and other things.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Sauda is a mother in her mid-thirties and has two sons who are at school. She is married and supports her family living by managing a business selling medicine (pharmacy). Sauda has been in this business for four years. Before she started it, she was employed as a nurse and pharmacist in someone's hospital. She steadily struggled for a long time and now manages her own business. Sauda's ambition is to be a greatly successful businesswoman. She works from 8 am to 9 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

She is requesting her fourteenth loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which paid were back successfully, she rented a nice business room, paid for six months of electricity and rent charges, and grew her business capital. Sauda received a profit which she used to plow back into her business to expand it. She will use this loan to replenish her business with more inventory. She really appreciates Kiva for their support. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tupendane A" which totals four members. Together, the group members will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with more inventory.

loans.name: Dioven Jr.

texts.en: Dioven is 25 years old and single. He has owned and managed a water refilling station within the local community for almost seven years. He plans to earn and save more income in order to support his parents in financing the education of his younger brother. He aims to improve and expand his business to other villages but he has not enough capital. For this reason, he wants to obtain a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy gallons of water, water dispensers and electric motors needed in water refilling. Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that someday he will expand the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy gallons of water, water dispensers and electric motors needed in water refilling.

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 22-year-old married woman whose husband left her at home to seek higher wages abroad. Three years ago she started selling bags and accessories in a small shop. Hanaa is acquiring a YOUTH loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop for the upcoming summer and tourist season, which is her busiest time of year. She is a strong believer in herself and anticipates growing her business even more through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her shop for the upcoming summer and tourist season, which is her busiest time of year.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron is 54 years old. He is married and they have been blessed with two children. He has been running his business for two years.

Currently he makes an estimated monthly income of KES.21,000.He would like a loan of KES.18,900 with which he will buy animal feed for farming his land. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans. 

He will use his income to buy food for his family and buy feed for his animals as well.

loans.use: to boost his farming by buying animal feed

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 28 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Judelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

Judelyn has been raising cattle for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 32 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Michelle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilanie

texts.en:
Lilanie is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lilanie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Lilanie has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from a fish pond.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, 46, is a villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with three children. Cassava growing and rice farming are the main sources for her to earn income. She is able to earn about 56,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four past loans which have been fully paid back and have had a positive impact in her household. Now, she is applying for the new loan. She is now leading a group to seek the new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and to pay for plowing for her farmland. She hopes that her cassava will produce a better yield so as to sell it at a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 41 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been pig fattening for six years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is 52 years old and married. She lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children; some are still in school. 

She supports her family by farming rice and working as a paid-worker. She has been engaged in these businesses for 28 years, and it has earned her about 37,100 KHR per day to support her family's needs.

She is the fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely, and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle so she is living better than before. 

Now she is leading a group consisting of three members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for plowing the land. 

She strongly believes that her cassava will produce a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and works hard to support her family. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Vilma requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more flowers to sell to customers.

Rochelle has been in this business for three years, and she earns more income from a general store.

Rochelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough  money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Nenita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en: Soeurng, a mother of four children, is a villager from the Dambae district of Kamporng Cham province. The main sources of income for her family are cassava farming and rice farming. She has been involved with this business for 16 years and it has returned her about 47,200 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one past loan which has been fully repaid and it has enabled her to uplift her condition of living better than before. Now, she leads a group of two for the loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting and plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. She hopes that she will collect a better yield than before and sell it at a good price.

loans.use: to pay harvesting and plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Som is 38 years old and a married father of five children. Two are in school and three are too young for schooling.

The main income source for his family is from cassava farming, which he has been involved in for 20 years. He can earn 36,100 KHR per day. 

He is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to pay for pesticide, fertilizer and  plowing fee. He hopes to collect a good yield and to sell it for a good price to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: To pay for pesticide, fertilizer and plowing fee.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is here again for another loan to pay tuition for her daughters in high school. She is grateful that they will soon be in university. She thanks the Kiva lenders for being supportive in contributing to an elite generation. She is a hardworking woman who desires the best for her children and will go extra miles to achieve it. Thank you Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughters.

loans.name: Soeur's Group

texts.en:
Soeur is 35 years old and a mother of two children who are still in school. She struggles for a living; she has been growing rice and cassava for  15 years. 

This current business earns her about 36,700 KHR per day. This is the third cycle loan for Soeur, and the first cycle for her joint borrower. She has completely repaid her last two loans, and has helped her to ease her family's financial burden. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and labor fees. 

She hopes to expand her business and to do bean farming to increase her income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Lenchonghoi (B) Group

texts.en:
Notwithstanding her young age, Lhingkhoneng quite understands the hardships and problems of the family as they were orphaned at a very young age. Lhingkhoneng lives in a village in Manipur, in the northeastern state of India, with her brothers and sisters. Her parents died when she was very young. Her elder brothers and sisters got married so the responsibility to look after her younger siblings rests entirely upon her. 

Initially, she did not have any source of income to manage the family. The only source to sustain the family was her father’s pension. She used the money to manage the family and for her younger brother’s education. To generate more income she engaged herself in doing quarry work near the river bank and earned daily wages. Unfortunately, the hard manual work took its toll on her health and she was forced to stop physical work on the doctor’s advice.

As she wanted to start her own income-generating business and needed financial assistant, she inquired among a few of her friends who are members of Kiva and they informed her that a loan could be accessed from WSDS, a partner with Kiva. She was delighted to know that there are generous people who could help her. With the first Kiva loan, she set up a small variety store near her house and in second and third loans she expanded and filled in more expensive items like sugar, rice, lentils etc in the store. Now, her store also deals in selling mobile recharge cards,  too.

The ideas of saving money enthused her and she started saving some amount daily. Thus the money she saved was used in repaying the loan amount, bought two calves, a refrigerator and a computer.

Lhingkhoneng is very happy that she could help in maintaining the family in some ways and in repaying the loan without any default or even much difficulty. She said, “I am so happy and satisfied with WSDS/Kiva as it helped me in changing my life and my family's. Previously I had to do manual labor for income-generating but now, I am settled in my business. I will try to access loans in future as well and try to help others in changing their lives as much as I can.”

Like her the rest of the group members are engaged in ginger farming and variety stores.

loans.use: To buy items like mobile recharge cards, rice, sugar, lentils, etc. and sell them for more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to re-stock her business with 500 layers.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is 42 and a resident from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and a mother of four children, three of whom are still in school while the oldest one is employed as a garment worker to financially support the family. Sokhoeurn earns a living by cropping rice, a business that she has been engaged in for more than 20 years.

Sokhoeurn and her husband would like to improve their family’s income, so they want to work out their plans and start a new business. To make their dream a reality, Sokhoeurn has applied for a loan in the sum of USD 350 to buy a trailer, which will be used for transporting goods/crops for local people in exchange for money, especially in raining and harvest season. 

This is a third loan for Sokhoeurn with Hattha Kaksekar and she has proved to be very punctual in repaying her loans.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for transporting goods/crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a van to increase his workload and provide more for his family.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who eight years ago established a hookah-selling shop that he is successfully managing.
 
Mohamad's ambition and positive vision led him to acquire a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner AL Majmoua in order to buy more merchandise for his shop. In addition to adding merchandise and increasing his revenue with this loan, he hopes open a café in the future to diversify his offerings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio Lucio se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carros que realiza servicio urbano, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Lucio, earns his living in the transportation business. He has a vehicle that provides urban public transport. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. He has already been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him. His dream is to buy a new vehicle. He is requesting the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

Lucio is happy about the loan and he promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is 64 years old and lives in the village Bror Hal in Bakan district, Pursat province. She described herself to be a small woman with no higher education. Since a very young age, An has been engaged in farming, a business that she learned from her parents. Since getting married, she has become even more serious about it. Her husband gives her a helping hand. Together, they have nine children.

By applying for this loan, An will use it to dig a pond to ensure enough water supply for daily consumption. She is hoping that she won’t face water shortages in the future, or that she won't need to spend much time to collect water from the far-distant areas, so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income for her family. She expresses her thanks in advance to all lenders.

loans.use: to dig a pond to ensure enough water supply for daily consumption

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rhoda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rhoda is borrowing 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Novariza

texts.en:
Novariza is 41 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Novariza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Novariza requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Novariza has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Novariza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 50 years old, married, and has five children. With two children currently in school, Sofia works very hard to provide for them.

Sofia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, shampoo, bath soap, detergent soap, etc. 

Sofia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Sofia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Warlina

texts.en:
Warlina is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Warlina is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Warlina has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Seng is a 45-year-old rural villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with six children; and four of them are in school. 

She earns her living mainly via cassava farming. She has been involved in the current business for 27 years and it earns her a decent income. 

She is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loans with success and they have helped her to provide decent food for her children. Now she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and labor fee and to buy insecticide and fertilizer. 

She highly believes that she can gain a good yield with a good income in return and expand her business as well.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and labor fee and to buy insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 49-year-old married man with six children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been in a goat-rearing business that he started many years back. He obtains additional income from farming. He is faced with a problem of lack of enough land to expand the grazing area for his goats. 

George is requesting for a loan to buy more goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a rural area located in the Ro Veang district of Preah Vihear province. Farming is her primary source of income. She earns additional income selling noodles. She earns approximately 15,000 KHR per day.

Sokhen requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Put

texts.en:
Put is 60 years old and widowed. He lives with his family in a rural area located in the Samki Meanchey district of Kompong Chnang province. Farming is the primary source of his family’s income to make a living. With the current business, he can earn approximately 16,700 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first loan for Put from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. He will use his loan to buy a cow and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to increase his current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the materials and supplies needed in making and repairing tricycles.

loans.name: Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is a treasurer of her group, has been supporting her family by managing a business selling varieties of items as per customer demand. Even if she is not selling what you want, she can order and deliver it to you freely. She sells shoes, women's handbags, women's and men's clothes, hair and beauty accessories. She has been in this enterprise operating at her house since 1995. 

Amina is a married mother of three schooling kids. She is aged in her late 30s and starts doing business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. Her business is able to make a good profit each month.

She has made more than one loan request through Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to maintain her customers' demand plus buying new business products. She has paid back successfully all of her previous loans. Amina used the profit to cover part of the school fees and household expenses and to plow back into her enterprise. She will use this loan to restock her business with more new inventories. In the coming years, Amina would like to be an international businesswoman with more success. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "HIARI YA MOYO," which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her business with more new inventories.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 26-year-old single man who worked in the construction field in the past, but over the last six months he has been managing his own cafe and hasn’t faced many difficulties thus far. His business is going well and his clients love the services he provides.

Hussein has repaid a successful microloan in the past, which has significantly improved his business and his family's well being. Now he has acquired a youth loan to buy a van in order to provide students in his neighborhood with the required transportation services. In the future he hopes to further develop his business and turn his cafe into a wider restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a van in order to provide students in his neighborhood with the required transportation services

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Teresa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Teresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening and from her general store. Yolanda is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Silvia Jeannette

texts.es:
Silvia actualmente está acompañada, sus estudios que ella realizo fueron hasta el bachillerato.  Antes era madre soltera hoy esta casada y su esposo es empleado trabaja cuidando una bodega, el niño que tienen ya va a la escuela va a segundo grado, en esa misma casa viven con ellos dos hermanos de Silvia.


Los abuelos de ella tienen una finca de café y ella les ayuda a ellos,  ya que obtiene un beneficio también, tiene unos cuantos años de dedicarse a esto, ella compra los palitos de café y va a sembrarlos, y le da seguimiento a la siembra de café, de esto obtienen sus ingresos. El lugar donde ella siembra es decir donde tiene la finca de café le queda a unos 20 minutos de su casa y su horario es de 7am  a 4pm.
     

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más palos de café para sembrar ahorita que es el tiempo y abono que le pone a las piletas donde siembra el café. Con este préstamo ella se verá muy beneficiada ya que su esperanza es que se le apruebe el crédito.

Sus sueños son Dios primero que todo le salga bien con esta siembra y que a futuro ella pueda tener su propia finca de café y poder ser una productora para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ayudarle a su hijo a que no le falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Silvia now lives in a common-law marriage. She studied through high school. Before, she was a single mother and today she is married and her husband is employed at a bodega. Their son is already going to school and is in the second grade. Silvia's two siblings live in the same house with them.

Her grandparents have a coffee farm and she helps them, as she benefits also. She has four years doing this trade. She buys the sticks of coffee and will plant them. Following the harvest she obtains her income. The place where she plants where she has her coffee farm is 20 minutes away from her home and her schedule is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy more sticks of coffee to plant now that it is the season, and fertilizer to put where she plants the coffee. With this loan she will benefit greatly and she hopes that it will be approved.

Her dreams are of God first and that all goes well with the harvest and that in the future she will be able to have her own coffee farm and be able to be a producer to help her husband with the household expenses and help her son so that he doesn't lack any necessities.

loans.use: to buy more coffee sticks to plan now that the it is the season and fertilizer that she can put on the land where she is planting the coffee.

loans.name: Flor De Maguey Group

texts.en:
María is a woman of Ethnicity Ixil Maya, she is 43 years old and lost her husband 10 years ago. Her husband fell ill with a stomach illness that could not be determined. Sadly, she says, "if I had credit at that time I had had enough income to take my husband to the hospital," but then she had no access to credit and did not generate revenue. After her husband's death, she had to work to support her 4 children. With big effort she started to improve her situation thanks to weaving and selling fabrics, and that´s how she managed to send her two daughters to school. The oldest one, who is now 17 years old, will graduate this year as an Accountant, which is a credit to her mother since she came through 2nd grade.

María works every day from 4:00 to 9:00 pm, combining 8 hours of weaving with housework. She is so active that she has not only generated income for her and her family, but also employs six poor women in her community.

With her credit María hopes to strengthen her textile business and hire porters to plant corn. She is very happy about having learned how to use credit and having  undertaken this business. She does not know what would have happened if she had not access to credit, she is pretty sure she had not been able to educate their daughters.

loans.use: to strengthen her textile business and hire porters to plant corn.

loans.name: Channai's Group

texts.en:
Channai is 19 years old and she is single. She is a villager from Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she is growing cassava and cashews. She has been involved in this business for one year. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles already and has fully paid back the loans, which have had a positive impact for her. For this cycle, she leads a group of two for a loan. She and her co-borrower are requesting loan for 2,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor fees, fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor fees, fertilizer and pesticide purchasing.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is 33 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Samki Meanchey district of Kompong Chnang province. She has two dependent children, and they study in the local area. Farming is the primary source and raising pigs is the second source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 19,300 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first loan for An from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy a tractor and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children at school.

loans.use: to buy a tractor and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbeng Meanchey district of Preah Vihear province, Lon is a 21-year-old married woman. She has one dependent child. Fishing has been the main source of income for her family, and they supplement that money with working. She can earn about 22,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the fourth loan for Lon from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she will apply for a new loan that she will use to buy fishing materials. She hopes to increase her current business so she can earn a larger income to make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Ciria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 35 años es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos (una niña de 8 año de edad y 2 jóvenes de 13 y 17 años de edad). Para sacar adelante a sus hijos se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo a las ventas de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes y todos los fines de semana elabora ricas sopas de Gallina India, sopa de Patas y de Res. Guadalupe y sus 3 hijos viven en casa propia. Guadalupe quiere construir un lavadero y un servicio sanitario con su ducha, por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el ladrillo de barro, cemento, arena, grava, hierro y azulejos, también pagará la mano de obra que estos trabajos requiere.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 35 year old single mother. She has three children, an 8 year old daughter and two sons aged 13 and 17. In order to bring up her children she has been selling beauty products for a long time now. She does this from Monday to Friday and on weekends she makes delicious traditional soups like sopa de gallina india and sopa de pata (cow's feet).

Guadalupe and her 3 children live in their own house. She wants to construct a washstand and a bathroom with a shower. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, re-bar and tiles and pay for labor that this work requires.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, re-bar and tiles to build a washstand and bathroom and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yanira Elena

texts.es: Yanira de 39 años de edad está casada y tienen 4 hijos (de 14, 16, 18 y 20 años de edad)todos ellos viven en casa propia que adquirieron hace 19 años. El esposo de Yanira trabaja de motorista y ella se ha dedicado desde hace 10 años a la venta de "enchape" por catálogo y a comercializar queso fresco que ella se encarga en preparar. Yanira ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, madera y otros materiales necesarios para construir un baño sanitario y construir una pequeña galera. Yanira se ha comprometido a pagar todas las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en:
Yanira is 39 years old. She is married and has four children (14, 16, 18, and 20 years old). They all live in their own house that they acquired 19 years ago. Yanira's husband works as a driver, and Yanira has earned her living for 10 years selling gold-plated jewelry from a catalog and selling "queso fresco" [a very soft white cheese] that she prepares herself. 

Yanira has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, wood, and other materials she needs to build a bathroom and a small shed. Yanira has promised to make all the payments that this loan requires.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wood, and other materials to build a bathroom and a small shed

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Sabali ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (concombres), condiments,  pagnes wax et charbon du bois.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Soundjè (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes (concombres). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   6 corbeilles de concombres à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Soundjè compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married and living in monogamous households, the five members of the Sabali group are on average 39 years old with an average of 4 children each. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako and came to know each other as neighbors and through their respective small businesses at the market in Djalakorodji.

The members of the group are in the business of vegetables (cucumbers), spices, wax "pagnes" (traditional colorful cloth of western Africa), and charcoal. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on the first group loan.

Soundjè (pictured sitting on the far right of the photo) is a large reseller of vegetables (cucumbers.) She plans to use her loan to purchase 6 baskets of cucumbers in Bamako. She resells it at retail in Djalakorodji to a customer base made up mostly of women. Soundjè plans to earn, with the help of this loan, an average monthly income of 45,000 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her household needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, clay bricks, sheet metal, nails, and other materials she needs to put up a wall and a roof for the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio actualmente esta dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, el  socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio a la vez continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de carne, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
 El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is currently earning his living providing taxi services. He is a responsible and hardworking person. He also continues working at his meat sales business. He would like to be able to keep working so that he can continue supporting his family. 

The member is requesting the loan to perform maintenance on his car. He feels grateful for the loan, and he promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Doris Beneranda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12  y 10 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Doris es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en el cual se dedica a la venta  de pescado por libras y por piezas, el todos los días en la madrugada se va hasta dicho mercado a recibir lo que los comerciantes mayoristas le dejan para luego poner a la venta el mejor producto para sus clientes que a diario van a este centro de abastos a surtirse de productos para el diario vivir, ya son más de 20 años que él lleva con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia de una forma honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella le ayuda a su marido con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The 'Familia Con Suerte' communal bank meets every fortnight in the Miraflores district of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which have lots of visitors throughout the year, as well as for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Doris lives. She is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship, from which she has 3 children aged 17, 12 and 10. The older ones go to secondary school and the youngest is at primary school. Her husband is a trader. Doris is a very good wife who is taking out the loan for her husband to use in his business. He has a stall in the Tarqui market where he makes a living selling fish by the pound or individually. Every day he goes to the market early in the morning to receive his delivery from the wholesale traders and then puts the best produce out to sell to his customers, who visit this central food market every day to stock up on daily necessities. He has been doing this job for more than 20 years and so is able to bring his family up in a dignified way.

This loan is to buy fish. Doris has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because it means she is able to help her husband with the loans. Their dream is to have premises of their own.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Doña Margoth es una buena clienta de  Fundación Mujer, ella es comerciante desde hace cinco años, cuenta con su esposo y una amiga  que se ha convertido en un apoyo muy grande para ella, le ha ayudado a organizarse mejor en su actividad económica. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada desde muy joven, en el momento que decidió asumir la responsabilidad de cuidar a su hermana menor, ya que su madre falleció. Actualmente vende por catálogo, ropa, zapatos, perfumes que trae desde la zona Sur; y hace cuatro meses instalo una soda en la cochera de su casa.
Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente la financiamos para que  comprara tennis, perfumes y ropa que le solicitaban sus clientas. Tiene cinco años de tener esta actividad económica que es un apoyo para el hogar.
Doña Margoth va cada tres meses a traer la mercadería a Golfito y Paso Canoas, con ayuda de su amiga, además de impulsarla abrir una soda ya que ella cocina muy bien, así lo realizo y actualmente le va muy bien con sus diferentes actividades porque las ha logrado combinarlas.
Ella desea este crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería que le han solicitado su clientela. Esto le va a permitir continuar apoyando en los estudios de sus hijas y el mejoramiento del hogar. 
Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y el buen trato.
texts.en:
Margoth is a good client of Fundación Mujer. She has been in business for 5 years now. She has the support of her husband and a friend who has become a great help to her. She has helped her organize her economic activity better. She has been a hard-working and forceful woman since she was young. When her mother died she decided to assume the responsibility for her younger sister.

Today she sells clothing shoes and perfumes from catalogues that she brings from the Southern Zone. And four months ago she opened a cafe in her garage. She has always worked in business. She had had loans to buy running shoes, perfume and clothing that her clients have requested. She has been doing this for 5 years to help support her household.

Margoth goes every 3 months to bring goods from Golfito and Paso Canoas. Her friend, besides urging her to open the cafe is a good cook. So Margoth has opened the cafe and things are going well with her various activities as she has manged to combine them. She wants this loan to invest in the purchase of goods that her clients have asked her for. This will allow her to continue to support her children's studies and make improvements on her house. She choose Fundación Mujer because of their low interest rates and good treatment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром добродушный  и очень трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат  и имеет двоих детей. Бахром живёт со своей женой и детьми в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Бахром  занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь, которая  составляет около 12 га. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле Бахром занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. 

Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Бахром хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Но сейчас ему необходимо закупить корм для своего скота на запас, но у него не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку корма для своего скота. Бахром заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a good-natured and very hard-working man. He is married and has two children. Bahrom lives with his wife and children in a small house in a rural village. Despite his age he is full of strength and the desire to work to help his family. Bahrom works doing farming and rearing animals. He has a plot of land of around 12 hectares. 8 hectares of that land is rainfed and the rest is irrigated. Bahrom grows carrots, potatoes and grain on this land. His wife helps him care for and rear the cattle. Since their land is big, they also graze their cattle on it.

The animal rearing business brings a good income and for that reason Bahrom wants to grow the business, increasing the quantity of his cattle. But now he needs to buy food to stockpile for his cattle but he does not have enough funds. Therefore he turned to Arvand, to receive a loan to buy food for his cattle. Bahrom thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy food for cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, malarial drugs, and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbeng Meanchey district of Preah Vihear province, Yorn is a 23-year-old married woman. She has three dependent children and they study in the local area. Catching and selling fish have been the main sources of her family’s income. Yorn can earn about 23,500 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Yorn from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she will apply for a new loan and use it to buy more fish to resell. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish and expand her business

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella vive en la ciudad de Echarate y donde realiza todas sus actividades , ella pertenece al banco comunal "Juntos por el Desarrollo de Echarate" desde hace varios  años, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas ropa como polos, camisas, blusas y poleras. Ella agradece a los inversionistas del banco comunal por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Edith is 45 years old and earns her living selling clothing. She lives in the city of Echarate, where she carries out all her activities. For several years, she has belonged to the "Juntos por el Desarrollo de Echarate" [Together for Growth in Echarate] communal bank.

At this time, she needs the loan to buy more clothing like t-shirts, shirts, blouses, and sweatshirts. She is grateful to the communal bank's lenders for the support provided and she promises to make her payments very responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like t-shirts, shirts, blouses, and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en: Charlene, 18 years old, lives happily with her parents and 8 siblings in Dingalan, Aurora. Despite her young age, she envisions a better life for her family. Charlene knows that earning a college diploma will open better opportunities for her future career, and a better career will enable her to achieve her dreams for her siblings and for her family. She doesn’t want her siblings to experience going to school without any money in their pockets like what she had.  An educational loan of 40,000 PHP will surely help her to go and finish college for her brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman who earns a living from her service-based business, providing transportation in her village. For more than two years, she has earned well with her pedi-cab transportation services and has saved a portion of her net income. 

Josephine borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase tires, a raincoat, and other accessories to add better services. She plans to buy more units of pedi-cab for expansion. 

In the future, she wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a raincoat, and other accessories.

loans.name: Victor Andres

texts.es: Victor tiene 19 años de edad y se dedica a la combustible de forma ambulatoria en un grifo rustico, él vive en la ciudad de Echarate y donde realiza todas sus actividades, él pertenece al banco comunal "Juntos por el Desarrollo de Echarate" desde hace un año, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas combustible. Victor agradece a los inversionistas del banco comunal por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Victor is 19 years old and he earns his living selling fuel rom a rustic mobile fuel pump. He lives in the city of Echarate, where he carries out all his business. For one year, he has belonged to the "Juntos por el Desarrollo de Echarate" [Together for the Growth of Echarate] communal bank. 

At this time, he needs the loan to buy more fuel. Victor is grateful to the communal bank's lenders for the support provided, and he promises to make his payments very responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy more fuel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coolers and plates for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Andeth district of Takeo province, Seun is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two dependent children and they study at the local area school. Farming has been the main source of her family’s income. She can earn about 64,400 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the fourth loan for Seun through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she will apply for a new loan, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sofia Del Consuelo

texts.es: Sofía tiene 57 años de edad, es miembro de una asociación de  mujeres que venden comida en  un lugar turístico los fines de semana, Sofía  es madre soltera y vive sola debido a que sus  4 hijos ya son mayores y son independientes, ella comenta que  le va bien en sus ventas  pero que para poder terminar la comida que ha preparado ella se queda en su puesto hasta las 11 de la noche y así logra terminar sus ventas, Sofía contrata  a una señorita para que le ayude a dar buena atención a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos que para ofrecerlos en su kiosco, Sofía aspira arreglar mas su negocio para que sea más bonito y más llamativo.
texts.en:
Sofia is 57 years old.  She is a member of the association of women who sell food in a touristy spot on weekends.  Sofia is a single mother and lives alone because her four children are all grown up and live independently.  

She says that it is going well for her in regards to her sales but that, in order to be able to finish the food that she has prepared, she stays in her stall until 11 p.m. in order to finish her sales.  Sofia has hired a young woman to help her give good service to her customers.  

She will invest her loan in the purchase of products to offer in her food stall.  Sofia hopes to fix up her business so that it is more attractive and attention-grabbing.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Yohanna Yalile

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Yohanna, tiene 31años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas, una de 10 años y una bebé de 8 meses, la mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es taxista.
Doña Yohanna es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice para arreglos en su taxi que está un poco deteriorado, necesita el crédito para arreglar las puertas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que esta es la fuente de ingresos que él tiene para sacar adelante a su familia, el lleva más de 10 años realizando esta actividad, trabajando día a día por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para arreglos del taxi. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en su hogar. Sus sueños es comprar un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The credit group Familia Con Suerte [Lucky Family] meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores, in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Yohanna lives.  She is 31 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has two daughters, one of whom is 10 years old and is in school, and the other is an 8-month-old baby. Her husband is a taxi driver. Yohanna is a very good wife who is getting the loan so that her husband can make repairs to his taxi which is not in very good condition. The doors need to be repaired to provide better service to his customers. The taxi is his source of income to provide for his family. He has been driving for more than 10 years, working day after day for the sake of his family.

Yohanna has been a member of the credit group since its inception and she likes it because it allows her to help her husband get ahead. Her dream is to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: to make repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 33 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is from a rural village of the Preah Vihear district of Preah Vihear province. Farming has been the main source of her family’s income. She earns about 23,900 KHR per day.

Mom requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is 23 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Somlot district of Battambang province. She doesn’t have any children. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 67,500 KHR per day.
