This is the first loan for Sophan through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Teresa Estrella

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 17, 10 y 6 años, los tres menores estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Teresa es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice para comprar una panga, el espera con esta pequeña embarcación realizar transporte de personal y carga desde los barcos pesqueros en alta mara a las playas de esta linda ciudad, este medio de transporte es muy utilizado y son pocos los que ofrecen este servicio por lo cual espera que le vaya muy bien a su marido para así tener mejores ingresos para el bien de su familia  ya que con lo que gana como guardia de seguridad no es suficiente para los gastos de su hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar una panga. Está desde el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus sueños es comprar su panga y que le vaya muy bien a su marido.
texts.en:
The 'Familia Con Suerte' communal bank meets every fortnight in the Miraflores district of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which have lots of visitors throughout the year, as well as for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Teresa lives. She is 37 years old and is married. From her marriage she has four children aged 22, 17, 10 and 6. The three younger ones are at university, secondary school and primary school. Her husband is a security guard. Teresa is a very good wife who is taking out the loan for her husband to use to buy a small boat. 

He hopes to use this boat to transport workers and cargo from offshore fishing boats to the beaches of this beautiful city. This means of transport is used a lot and there are few people offering this service, so she hopes this will work out well for her husband so that they can have more income which will benefit the family. The money he earns as a security guard is not enough to cover the household costs.

This loan is to buy a small boat. Teresa has been in the communal bank since the second loan cycle and likes it because of the help she gets from the loans to bring up her family. Her dream is to buy the small boat and for things to work out well for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a small boat.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Agustina, tiene 60 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de  edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Agustina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también parte del crédito es para realizar algunos arreglos en su casa ya que el baño esta en malas condiciones, quiere repararlo para mejorar su calidad de vida. La ropa deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva  2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que le sirven para mejorar su hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y materiales de construcción  para mejora su hogar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 7 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es tener bien arreglada su casa.
texts.en:
The “Family with Luck Credit Group” meets each 15 days in Miraflores barrio in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in all the seasons of the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here resides Mrs. Agustina who is 60 years old and lives in a common law relationship that has resulted in 4 children, all adults now, though one still lives with them. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Agustina sells clothing from catalogs with the intention of earning money for her budget and thereby advancing her household. Her mode of selling is door to door. An additional part of the loan is to finance some repairs to her house, since the bathroom is in bad condition and she wants to repair it in order to improve the family's quality of life. 

Agustina sells clothing to her customers on credit, making collections every 8 to 15 days. She has done this for 2 years now, earning something to help improve her home. This loan will be used to purchase clothing and construction materials to improve her home. 

Agustina has belonged to this Credit Group through 7 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to live in a decent house.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business and construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Hieng is 41 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province. She has one child. Farming rice is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately KHR 46,000 per day.

This is the first loan for Hieng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of the Battambang province, Hieng is a 20-year-old married mother of one daughter. Farming rice has been the main source of her family’s income. She can earn about 27,800 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Hieng from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 26-year-old single man who works as a waiter in a café. His four years of experience has given him the skills it takes to deal with a variety of clients. He works very hard, often until late night hours, to make enough to provide his family with good living conditions.
 
Alaa finds his income to be barely enough to cover all of his increasing demands. He considers Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to be his only hope in acquiring a new youth loan to settle some necessary car maintenance fees so that he can safely get to work on time.

loans.use: to settle some necessary car maintenance fees so that he can safely get to work on time.

loans.name: Alba Maritza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Alba y su marido se dedican al comercio, todos los días instalan una mesa en un sector llamado Playita Mía, lugar en el cual muchas personas visitan para comprar todos tipo de mariscos, ellos venden camarón por libras y al por mayor si así lo desean sus clientes, este negocio lo atiende su marido mientras que ella también vende camarón en su casa a vecinos y conocidos de la localidad, son más de 2 años que él lleva con esta actividad  la misma que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar camarón. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ellos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un gran  local.
texts.en:
The “Family with Luck Credit Group” meets each 15 days in Miraflores barrio in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in all seasons, and as a city of unequaled beauty, with many tourist attractions.

Here lives Sra. Alba, 28 years old, in a common law union that has produced a son, now aged 6, who is currently in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Alba and her husband are both merchants. Every day they set up a table in the sector called Playita Mia, a place where many people visit to purchase all types of sea food. They sell shrimp by the pound and at wholesale, if the customers so desire. Her husband attends to the business while Alba also sells shrimp at home to neighbors and friends from the locality. They have had this business for over 2 years and it has helped them advance.

This loan is for purchasing shrimp. They have belonged to the Credit Group from the beginning and they like it because it helps them get ahead. Their dreams are of having a grand store.

loans.use: to buy shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old single man and Palestinian refugee. Two years ago he started his own hookah café in the refugees’ camp where he lives, despite his lack of capital and savings. Today, his business is making good progress and his café is frequented by a large number of residents in the camp.

Mohamad is an ambitious person who looks for better chances in life. He has acquired a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to purchase more hookahs and charcoals for his café, in effort to grow his business and increase his revenue. In the future Mohamad intends to establish a charcoal supply store and distribute his coals all around Lebanon.

loans.use: to purchase more hookahs and charcoals for his café, in an effort to grow his business and increase his revenue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Komsot

texts.en:
Komsot is 27 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province. She has two children. Farming rice is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 27,800 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Komsot through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nueva Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Unión está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde en su gran mayoría se encuentran mejorando sus condiciones de vida para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felipa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra mejorando sus condiciones de vida  y la de su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es costurera, y que se dedica a la confección de sabanas, fundas, colchas, pantalón, etc., Se  destaca el trabajo de la señora, quien está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Felipa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas variadas, para poder seguir con su trabajo y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Nueva Unión group is in its second cycle as a communal bank of women, in which all its members work and help one another get ahead. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey, and the great majority of the participants have been found to be improving the living conditions of their families.
One of the group members is Felipa, who fell into "level 3" poverty during the last survey cycle, which means that she is improving her living conditions and helping her family. Felipa is a seamstress, in addition to doing other types of work. She sews sheets, pillowcases, bedspreads and pants. Her work stands out and he is working hard to improve her family's circumstances. 
Felipa requests this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of fabrics so that she will be able to continue with her work and fulfill the orders of her clients. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Orn is 29 years old and married, with one dependent child. Farming rice has been the main source of her family’s income. She can earn about KHR 55,200 per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Orn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she will apply for a new loan. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chhaya

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Chhaya is 29 years old and married, with one daughter. Farming rice has been the main source of her family’s income. She can earn about KHR 46,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Chhaya with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she will apply for a new loan. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Adolfo es viudo, tiene 2 hijos ya adultos, y comenta que desde joven empezó como secretario en un taller mecánico, y con lo poco que ganaba estudiaba y ayudaba a su familia.
Con el tiempo aprendió todos los secretos de la parte mecánica, y como le gustaba la rama de rectificación de motores empezó a especializarse en ese rubro, y así fue que en el año 1990, con sus ahorros, y con su conocimiento y especialización logro formar su taller propio y hoy día ya tiene su clientela bien formada.
Actualmente le va muy bien en su negocio, y quiere poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Pide este préstamo para poder cambiar su vehículo, ya que el que tiene le es pequeño para poder trabajar en el.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a widow and has 2 adult children. He says that from a young age he started as a clerk in an auto repair shop, and with the little he earned he studied and supported his family. 

Over time he learnt all the secrets of being a mechanic, and since he liked the branch of fixing engines he started to specialise in this field. And so in 1990 he was able to set up his own workshop using his savings and his specialized knowledge, and now he has an established clientele. His business is now going well, and he wants to be able to continue growing as he has been up until now.

He is asking for this loan to change his vehicle, because the one he has is too small for him to use for his work.

loans.use: to change the vehicle he uses for his workshop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita owns and operates a retail business in their village to earn a living. She has been with her business for eight years and earns well to sustain their living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods.

Aside from this, she also has a farm where she gains more income for the family. She took a new loan again to purchase organic fertilizer in order to have a greener farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras se llama este grupo, se encuentra en el 6to. Ciclo del programa, tiene 18 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo caracterizado por la unidad, solidaridad, responsabilidad entre ellas, la mayor parte de sus integrantes cuentan con actividades comerciales actualmente,  y las que no están emprendiendo con el objetivo de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Zunilda de  45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos varios por la ciudad y sus alrededores, con la ayuda de sus hijos. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y lucha por poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser jabones, aceites, comestibles y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group called Las Emprendedoras is in its sixth loan cycle. There are currently 18 members. The group is characterised by the unity, solidarity and responsibility between the members. The majority of members currently have businesses and those who do not are starting out with the aim of growing and improving their lives.

One of the stories worth mentioning is that of Zunilda. She is 45 years old and makes a living selling various products in the city and surrounding areas, with the help of her children. She says that through her work she is able to help her family and she strives to give them all the things that she wasn't able to have.

She is asking for this loan to buy various products to sell, such as soap, oil, food and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity which they are being given.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, food and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesus 2 está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen.
Norma es una de las integrantes, y además de eso es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas variadas, que con mucho sacrificio sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está ayudando a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de jeans, camisas, remeras y demás tipo de prendas, con las que podrá seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus ingresos y continuando con la ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño Jesus 2" communal bank is in their 2nd cycle of the Woman's Committee Program where they work and help each other to get ahead through the continual work and effort of the whole group. All of them actively participate in the proposed activities for the group and help each other achieve the goals they have in common.

Norma is one of the members and is also the president of the group. She buys and sells a variety of clothing which she sells in the streets with a lot of effort. She is a hard-working person and a fighter who with effort and sacrifice supports her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy jeans, shirts, T-shirts and other types of clothing so that she can continue with her sales, increase her profits and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, T-shirts and all kinds of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, she will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that she can provide better conditions for her family.
 
Evan is a hard-working mom, who makes a living with her own farm -- a banana farm where she earns well while her husband works as an electrician.

Evan started the business a number of years ago. She works alone from early in the morning when her husband is busy with his work. But they go together more often on weekends. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm. Rest assured she will have a better future for she is determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Elrose

texts.en:
Elrose is married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For years, Elrose has earned from raising pigs for sale. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for this activity.

To improve this, she took a new loan again to buy feeding supplies. She always finds ways in order to augment their situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan owns and manages a bakery, making assorted breads and cakes for sale. She has been in this business for years.

Susan had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy ingredients; she was able to sustain the business. Her products have a better taste, so many customers come back to buy more. 

To cater to her clients demands, she took a new loan recently to purchase raw ingredients for baking. 

Hopeful she will have enough to improve the business, to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Faride

texts.es: Faride de 57 años de edad es la propietaria de una miscelanea ubicada en su propia vivienda desde hace 3 años. Su idea de negocio inicó cuando fue impulsada por una buena a miga para que generara ingresos mediante la actividad comercial en la que podia asesorarla, pues su amiga tenia la experiencia. Cuando empezó incirtíó un pequeño capital y hoy lo ha incrmentado pues es reconocida en el sector donde habita. Su microempresa funciona desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche  y compra de contado en almacenes del centro de la ciudad que le ofrecen buenas oportunidades para obtener utilidades tambien vendiendo de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento, segundo que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  almohadas y ropa variada para la venta, con lo cual pretende incrementar sus inventarios y continuar  mejrando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Faride, 57 years old, has owned for 3 years a general store located in her home. Her business idea started through a good friend, who had experience and advised her so she would earn income through this commercial activity. When she started she invested a small capital, and today she has increased it because she is recognized in the area where she lives. Her small company is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening. She buys in cash at department stores in the downtown area of the city, which offer her good conditions to get earnings by selling also in cash. Currently she is applying for a new loan, her second with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo", with which she will buy pillows and different types of clothing to sell. She intends to increase her stock and continue improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pillows and a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 51, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Cecilio, a cashier, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Adelaida maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Adelaida's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Adelaida hopes that her business will be more profitable and dreams of having a house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Thi is 28 years old and married. She has two dependent children and they study in the local area. Farming rice has been the main source of her family’s income. She can earn about 52,100 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Thi from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she will apply for a new loan. She will use it to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children at school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing material for resale

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Because Dalal is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. 

Dalal was born in 1959. She is married, and a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a retired man, and his pension wasn't enough to cover his children's needs. So Dalal started selling blankets and bed covers to help her family financially. 

Now she is seeking a loan to expand the quantity of blankets and bed sheets so that she will raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and bed sheets for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante del tercer año de la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática. Actualmente se encuentra sin trabajo, pues la carga horaria de su carrera no le permite asumir un trabajo. Sus padres lo apoyan totalmente, su madre es licenciada en Matemáticas y su padre visitador médico. Viven juntos en familia.  Su meta futura es poder obtener su título y ejercerlo. Desea siempre enriquecer sus conocimientos y poder aplicar sus conocimientos en algún negocio de su propiedad. 
Con este préstamo estaría abonando el pago de derecho a exámenes y una cuota.
texts.en:
Jose is a third year student in the Computer Engineering degree program. Currently he is unemployed, as the course load of his degree program does not allow him to take on a job. His parents support him completely. His mother has a degree in Mathematics, and his father is a medical sales representative. They live together as a family. 

Jose's future goal to be able to obtain his degree and put it to use. He would like to continually enrich his knowledge and be able to apply that knowledge in his own business.

With this loan, he will be paying his exam fees and tuition.

loans.use: to pay exam fees and tuition

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna es de la ciudad de Pilar, es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, comenta que siempre quiso ayudar a las demás personas y es por eso que escogió esta carrera.
Su sueño es poder recibirse y también poder ayudar a su familia y retribuirles toda la ayuda que estos siempre les ha dado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por poder cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en: Mirna is from the city of Pilar and she is studying nursing. She comments that she has always wanted to help others and that is why she choose this career. Her dream is to be able to graduate and be able to help her family and repay all the help that they have always given her. She is requesting this loan to pay her university tuition so she can continue her studies and struggle to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Gianfranco

texts.es:
Gianfranco es estudiante del primer semestre de la carrera de Química. Actualmente se encuentra sin trabajo, pues la carga horaria de su carrera inicia del medio día hasta la noche. Sus padres lo apoyan totalmente, su madre es licenciada en Matemáticas y su padre visitador médico.
Su meta es poder obtener su titulo y de esa forma trabajar, así como también poder enseñar.
Desea siempre enriquecer sus conocimientos en lo que lo apasiona que es la Química y en el ejercicio de su profesión lograr su progreso económico. 
Con este préstamo quiere abonar el pago de unos libros y unas cuotas para derecho a examen.
texts.en: Gianfranco is a student in his first semester of studying Chemistry. At present he does not have a job as his study timetable runs from midday until the night. His parents support him totally. His mother has a degree in mathematics and his father is a pharmaceutical salesman. His goal is to get his degree and obtain work and also be able to teach. He wants to continually increase his knowledge in what interests him, chemistry, and in working in his profession advance himself economically. With his loan he wants to pay for some books and pay for fees to take his exams.

loans.use: to buy books and pay fees.

loans.name: Fiamma

texts.es:
Fiamma estudia la carrera de Licenciatura en Informática, vive con su mama que se encarga de ayudarle en los estudios, y que siempre ha sido su sostén y apoyo.
Fiamma es una persona con ganas de superarse, es muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir con sus metas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Fiamma is studying to get a degree in Information Technology, she lives with her mother who helps her with her studies and who has always been her strength and support.

Fiamma is person with a desire to better herself; she is very responsible and dedicated to her studies and her family. She hopes to be a good professional and to continue studying and helping people.

She is asking for this loan to pay her university fees, and in this manner continue working towards accomplishing her goals. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Jhordan

texts.es:
Jhordan  es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es estudiante de la carrera de Agronomía, y comenta que sus objetivos son graduarse en el área de agro y seguir escalando en su trabajo de manera a poder aumentar sus ingresos, y poder dar a sus hijos un futuro mejor al que él tuvo. 
Jhordan es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Jhordan is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying a course in Agricultural Science and says his aim is to graduate in the field of agriculture and continue to get on at work so he can increase his income and give his children a better future than the one he had. Jhordan is a very hard-working person who wants to make progress in life so he can help other members of society.

He is asking for this loan so he can pay for his university fees, so he can continue to work towards his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Chery

texts.en:
Chery is married with two children; she manages a farm. Her husband is a carpenter. 

To help him, Chery cultivates and sells bananas, and grows and harvests coconut and corn, their main sources of income. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for farm fertilization.  

She requested a loan recently to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, in order to have a greener farm.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar está estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, comenta que le gustaría tener algún día su propio consultorio, ya que ama a los animales, es por eso que decidió estudiar esta carrera.
El comenta que todos los días viaja una gran distancia para ir a la universidad, pero dice que todo el esfuerzo vale la pena para ayudar a su familia también, con quienes vive actualmente.
Cesar pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Cesar is studying to be a veterinarian. He comments that he would one day like to have his own practice. He loves animals, that is why he choose this career. He says he travels a great distance each day to get to the university but it is worth the effort as it helps his family with whom he lives. Cesar is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university tuition and in this way continue his dream of becoming somebody in this life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moises está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería eléctrica, es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, y quiere poder recibirse para ayudar a las demás personas en lo que pueda de acuerdo a sus estudios.
Él está luchando por cumplir su meta, ya que es muy difícil poder trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención y de transporte. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y estudiando.
texts.en:
Moises is studying a degree course in Electrical Engineering. He is very committed to his studies and wants to be able to graduate so he can help other people as much as he can with their studies. He is working hard to achieve his goal, although it is very difficult to be able to work and study at the same time.

He is asking for this loan to cover his maintenance and transport costs. He is grateful for the opportunity he is being given to be able to continue improving and studying.

loans.use: to pay maintenance and transport costs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an ice candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and fish vending.

Lucila is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy making.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en:
Saveth is 38 years old and she is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with two kids who are still in school. For her family, rice farming is the main source for her to earn income, which she has done for ages. She also earns extra income via a paid-working job. It is the business that she earned income 26,300 KHR for feed the family in a timely manner. 

This is the second-time loan for Saveth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, her family’s situation is getting better from  her past loan; she has completely paid back the past loan. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. 

She highly believes that her income will increase from this business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras, ya que todas las integrantes son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se han fijado el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con miras a mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dionicia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3,  lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando, todo esto gracias al trabajo que hace en su venta de joyas y de ropas, también se debe destacar el entusiasmo que tiene y las ganas de superarse que muestra.
La Sra. Dionicia pide  este préstamo para la compra de aros, cadenillas, pulseras y anillos en platería, lo que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar cada día mas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Entrepreneurial Women), as all the members are very hard working and courageous women who have taken care to ensure the growth of each person, not only in economic terms but also personally. They also form part of the programme to eliminate poverty, with a view to improving their lives.

One of the members is Dionisia, who in her last survey was found to be to be within poverty level 3, that is to say she has improved, all thanks to the work she has selling jewellery and clothes. The enthusiasm that she has, as well as the drive to improve should also be highlighted.

Dionisia is asking for this loan to buy hoop earrings, necklaces, bracelets and rings from the silversmith, which will enable her to continue selling, and fighting to improve more every day. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy hoop earrings, necklaces, bracelets and rings from the silversmith.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrián vive en la ciudad de San Pedro, vive con sus padres y hermanos, ellos le ayudan a solventar sus gastos de la facultad, y de esa forma puede ir luchando por sus sueños.
No trabaja aun, solo  estudia  pero le gustaría trabajar después de terminar su carrera de contabilidad. Tiene la ilusión de seguir otra carrera más adelante y así tratar de ser más competitivo en el mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y cubrir gastos de materiales de estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Adrián lives in the city of San Pedro. He lives with his parents and siblings; they help him to pay for his university expenses so that he can keep striving toward his dreams.

He doesn't work yet; he only studies, but he would like to work after finishing his accounting degree. He has hopes of pursuing another degree later on to try to be more competitive in the labor market.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay for his enrollment and cover the costs of educational materials. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving to be able to continue his education.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment and cover educational expenses.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is married, and a resident of Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. She has managed a farm, their main source of income, for more than four years. She earns a good income from this activity. She was able to repay successfully her previous loan, which she used for fertilization.

She took another loan recently, to purchase fertilizer and pay replanting costs. Virgincita hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move the goods in the marketplace, and obtain more income, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay replanting costs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Química. Sus padres trabajan y viven en el Interior del País pero casi todos sus hermanos trabajan y estudian en la capital.
Comenta que le fue muy difícil poder despegarse de su familia para poder estudiar, pero que todo lo que hace es para ser una profesional útil a la sociedad y a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of San Lorenzo, and is studying for her degree in Chemistry.  Her parents work and live in the interior of the country, but almost all of Teresa's siblings work and study in the capital.  

Teresa commented that it was very difficult to leave her family to study, but everything she is doing is so that she can become a professional and be useful to society and others.

Teresa is requesting this loan to invest in paying her tuition, and thus be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay tuition for university

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly buys newly harvested rice and sells it in volume in town order to provide for the needs of her four children.  A portion of her stocks are used for their consumption and she sells the remainder in her village. 

Merly requested another loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase more rice to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living standard of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en: Thuraya was born in 1975. She is married and has five sons and daughters. Her husband is a retired man. Because of Thuraya's sense of responsibility, she started helping her husband with the household expenses, by making yogurt and cheese at her house and selling them to her friends and neighbors. Now she is seeking to expand her business, by buying more milk and some tools that she needs to make the work easier. This would raise her productivity. But she doesn't have enough money to do it. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more milk and the tools she needs, for making yogurt and cheese

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is 27 years old and divorced. She started her own business selling cosmetics, accessories, and artificial trees at her house to people in her area. 

As Kefah's business has become successful and profitable, she is now seeking to expand the quantity of the products she sells, but she does not have enough money to do so. Kehah requested a loan, which she will use to purchase cosmetics, artificial trees, and accessories for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, artificial trees, and accessories for her business

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar a su único hijo.



José tuvo que abandonar la escuela desde los 8 años, él le ayudaba a su padre a realizar jornales en las haciendas y a sembrar maíz, hoy en día José cultiva 1 hectárea de maíz y está a 1,000 mts de distancia de su casa.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo será invertido para comprar los insumos agrícolas para cultivar una hectárea  de maíz. 



El sueño de José es poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, le gustaría mejorar sus vivienda, y tener más ganado ya que solo cuenta con dos.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and studied as far as fourth grade of primary school. He is married and his wife takes care of the household tasks and looks after their only son. José had to give up his schooling at the age of 8 and helped his father as a day labourer on farms and planting corn. Nowadays José grows a hectare of corn which is a kilometre from his house.

The loan he is asking for from Credicampo will be used to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate a hectare of corn. José's dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life. He would like to improve their home and have more cattle, since he only has two.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro de 59 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta primer grado en la escuela, pues sus padres pensaban que era una pérdida de tiempo. Actualmente está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos que ya formaron su propia familia.


Pedro ha sido agricultor toda su vida, tiene muchísima experiencia, gracias a que su padre le inculcó y le enseño la forma de trabajar y ahora junto a uno de sus hijos producen una hectárea de maíz.



El crédito solicitado lo necesita para sembrar una hectárea de maíz, ya que actualmente no cuenta con el capital necesario.

Él sueña con tener mucho ganado y un terreno propio donde estas puedan mantenerse. También le gustaría que la producción este año aumente y sacar buenos ingresos al final del mes.
texts.en:
Pedro is 59 years old and could only study up to Grade 1 as his parents felt that it was a waste of time. Today he is in a common-law relationship and has 5 children who form his family. Pedro has been a farmer all his life. He has a lot of experience thanks to his father teaching him and now with his children he produces a hectare of corn. The loan he is requesting is needed to plant the corn as he does not have sufficient capital. His dream is to have a lot of cattle and his own land to support his family. He would also like to have greater production this year and have good revenues at the end of the season.





Pedro ha sido agricultor toda su vida, tiene muchísima experiencia, gracias a que su padre le inculcó y le enseño la forma de trabajar y ahora junto a uno de sus hijos producen una hectárea de maíz.







El crédito solicitado lo necesita para sembrar una hectárea de maíz, ya que actualmente no cuenta con el capital necesario.



Él sueña con tener mucho ganado y un terreno propio donde estas puedan mantenerse. También le gustaría que la producción este año aumente y sacar buenos ingresos al final del mes.

loans.use: to plant a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a los escasos recursos de su familia. 
Ahora él está acompañado y su esposa cuida a sus hijos y realiza los oficios del hogar.

Desde muy pequeño trabajaba junto a su padre sembrando maíz y realizando jornales en las algodoneras y tiene mucha experiencia, ahora cultiva 15,000 mts de maíz y está a 800 mts de distancia de su casa.

El crédito será invertido para el alquiler de terreno en el que cultivará maíz. 


El sueño de Víctor es tener un terreno propio donde sembrar, desea salud para poder trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor, who is 42 years old, did not have the opportunity to have an education because of his family's limited resources. Now he has a partner and she looks after their children and does the domestic tasks. From a young age he worked alongside his father growing corn and working as a day labourer in cotton production. He has a lot of experience. He now grows 15,000 metres of corn which is 800 metres away from his house.

He will use the loan to pay the rent on the land where he will grow corn. Victor's dream is to have his own plot of land where he can grow crops. He hopes for good health to be able to work and bring his family up.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está casado y su esposa cuida de su hijo y ejerce las labores del hogar.



Rodrigo aprendió el trabajo de peluquero a los17 años de edad, ahora es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Su trabajo está a 4.5 km de su casa, trabaja de lunes a domingos de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.



El crédito será invertido para comprar materiales y equipo para la peluquería.



Su sueño es tener su propia peluquería, el cual gracias al  préstamo se le estará cumpliendo, además mejorar la vivienda y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 31 years old and studied as far as ninth grade. He is married and his wife looks after their son and does the household tasks. Rodrigo learnt to be a hairdresser at the age of 17 and now it is his family's only source of income. He work place is 4.5km from his house and he works from Monday to Sunday from 8am to 4pm.

The loan will be used to buy materials and equipment for the hairdressing salon. His dream is to have his own salon, and he will be working towards this with the help of the loan. He also wants to improve his home and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for the hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun, 49, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has been blessed with three kids. Now only two of them are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of her income is growing pineapple, and she supplements her family's income by working for others, for a fee. She has been with this business for 11 years, and it has earned her 36,700 KHR per day.

She is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely to paid back her previous loans, and they enabled her to uplift her living conditions better. She is seeking a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her agribusiness and to pay a fee for plowing. She hopes to improve her standard of living, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay a fee for plowing

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, está casado y su esposa es cosmetóloga, y tienen 2 hijas de las cuales solo una está estudiando.


José se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante toda su vida, oficio que aprendió de su padre, además aprendió el oficio de mecánico a la edad de 23 años esas son sus dos fuentes de ingresos con los cuales lleva el sustento a su familia.

El crédito será invertido para la siembra de 6 hectáreas de maíz y yuca y para comprar todos los insumos agrícolas.


José sueña con poder ayudar a sus hijas para que continúen los estudios en Educación Superior, mejorar la vivienda y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 44, studied up to the fifth grade. He is married and his wife is a cosmetician. They have two daughters; only one goes to school. José has worked in agriculture all his life, something his father taught him. He also learned auto mechanics when he was 23. These are his two sources of income and how he sustains his family.

He is requesting a loan to grow corn and cassava in a six-hectare piece of land and to buy all the agricultural supplies he needs. José dreams of helping his daughters so that they can study at the university, and of improving his house and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to plant six hectares of land with corn and cassava and buy all the supplies he needs.

loans.name: Yavy

texts.en:
Yavy is a 43-year-old villager from the Kandal Steung district of the Kandal province. She is a widowed mother of four children, and two of them are currently in school. To overcome her financial burden, she farms rice, and also supplements the family's income by working as a garment worker. She has engaged in this business for more than nine years, and she can earn 35,600 KHR per day. 

Yavy has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As a new borrower this cycle, she is seeking loan for 4,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy one decent motorbike and to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to live in a decent and comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy one decent motorbike and to renovate her house

loans.name: Arbe Yaniyeth

texts.es:
Arbe tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen dos hijos quienes estudian educación básica.

Arbe está al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar, ella conoce el oficio de la agricultura gracias a su padre,  hoy junto a su esposo, siembran 2 hectáreas de cultivo de maíz, la cual está a 1,000 mts de su casa.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto.

Lo que Arbe mas desea es ayudar a su esposo para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de que estudien, y mejorar su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Arbe is 42 years old. She studied up to the third grade. She is in a relationship, her partner works in agriculture and they have two children who go to primary school. Arbe works taking her of her children and of the household chores. She also works in agriculture; her father taught her. She and her husband grow corn in a two-hectare piece of land located 1,000 meters from her house.

Arbe is requesting a loan to buy cattle for fattening. Arbe’s biggest wish is to help her husband so that they can give their children the opportunity to study and improve their humble home.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom attends school. She is also looking after her sister-in-law. She has been selling charcoal from her home at retail for the last four years, working seven days a week. She also collects income from tenants occupying her two rooms. She has requested a loan of Ug.Shs 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to increase her stock of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include thieves. Her dream is to be able to stock more charcoal straight from the villages and do away with middle men who raise the cost of charcoal.  She joined MCDT because of the timely loans. She stays with her husband in their house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: 020506010003 Hải Long-Hphong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cương works in agriculture farming livestock. She request a loan to purchase food for the cows, her cows born the calf and she sell the calf.
Cương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. 

Cương is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 020506010003 Hải Long-Hphong Group solidarity group. 
Cương lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Cương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Cương hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase food for the cows, her cows born the calf and she sell the calf.

loans.name: 7 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Vui is 61 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Vui works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Vui faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Vui is the group leader of the 7 Đông Hải Group solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting the loan to purchase baby poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

With her business profit, Vui hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 43, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her two children, and all by herself she manages their household while operating her business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business.* She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. The income she gets from this is called boundary (daily quota).** The regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

Lolita dreams of having another jeepney unit and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members*** every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

**In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. Essentially, the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the boundary payment, minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

***All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water, and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of chicken to expand her business

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y su esposo es agricultor con el cual tiene tiene 4 hijos.


Blanca realiza los oficios del hogar, además tiene una venta de pupusas los fines de semana, también junto con su esposo producen 1 hectárea de maíz.

El crédito que solicita a CrediCampo será invertido para comprar todos los insumos agrícolas que necesitará para producir  7,000 mts de maíz. 



Ella sueña con aumentar la producción este año y que no haya demasiada perdida, además de tener salud para realizar su trabajos y así mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is 51 years old. She could not go to school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have four children. Blanca works as a housewife. She also sells pupusas [thick corn tortillas] during the weekends. She also helps her husband to grow corn in a one-hectare piece of land.

Blanca is requesting a loan at CrediCampo to buy all the agricultural supplies she needs to grow corn in 7,000 square meters of land. Her dream is to increase her production this year and decrease the losses. She also hopes to keep her good health in order to work and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies she needs to grow corn in a 7,000 m2 piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is 47 years old, and she is widowed and has no kids. She lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Pineapple growing is the main source of her income, in which she has been involved for 11 years. She also works as a paid laborer for others, for extra income.

This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. Morn will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing the land. She hopes to increase her income and earn more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing the land.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° año de educación Básica, por situaciones económicas sus padres no lo mandaron a estudiar por lo que tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura, hoy en día está a acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar a su hija que todavía no asiste a la escuela y es la única que depende de él.


La agricultura es la actividad a la cual Concepción se dedica y lo aprendió de su padre, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos para el destazo y a la venta, por lo tanto es otro ingreso para su familia y su esposa se involucra en el trabajo.


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar los fertilizantes para lo producción de maíz y frijol, comprará ocho sacos de abono y pagará a los jornales para la siembra.


El sueño más grande Concepción es  poner a estudiar a su hija y que sea profesional y mantener unida siempre a su familia, seguir ayudando al desarrollo de la comunidad ya que él es un líder que ha dirigido varios proyectos.
texts.en:
Concepción, 35, studied up to the third grade of primary school. His parents could not continue to pay for his education, so he had to work in agriculture. He is married now; his wife works as a housewife and taking care of her daughter, who is not in school age yet and depends on him. Concepción works in agriculture, taught by his father. He also raises chickens and sells the meat, an additional income for the family. His wife helps him.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans. He will buy eight bags of fertilizer and pay for the labor needed to sow. His biggest dream is to pay for his daughter’s education so that she can become a professional. He also dreams of keeping his family together. He wants to continue being a leader that helps his community to develop and has led several projects.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
The Sari Karya group is located west of Bali, near Melaya village. This group is borrowing a loan of 22,400,000 IDR and they can pay off on time. The repayment is represented by the head of the group, Ni Ketut.

Ni Ketut shares her story to MUK's Staff that the development of her pigs is running well. Before the loan, she only had one pig and now, because of the loan, she has four piglets and one sow. The sow gave birth to nine healthy piglets. She sold the piglets after two months to pay off the loan. She also set aside savings and fulfilled her family's daily needs. All the member of Sari Karya feel the benefits from this business. They can support their husbands' incomes. The group expects another training from MUK for better knowledge of pig breeding.

After the success with her sows, Ni Ketut continue her business as a piglets seller. Her piglets have good quality because she keeps them well and gives them nutritious feeds and vitamin. She also became an example to other breeders, not only in her group, but also in her village.
  
With same loan size, she will use her loan to purchase superior quality feed and renovate the cage. Now Ni Ketut and the Sari Karya group hope that they can be independent in terms of capital. She hopes her plan can run smoothly.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed and renovate the cage.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase plastics, palm nuts, and jewelry

loans.name: Nhóm 1 Thôn 6 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

 Hà is 42 years old, and she is married with two children. Hà is the group leader of the  Nhóm 1 Thôn 6 Quảng Thái Group solidarity group, which consists of three members. Hà lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to resell.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a kind woman from a rural area. She was born in 1968. Sharifa has three children. All of them are adults. She is the only breadwinner in her family because her husband doesn’t work anywhere. 

Sharifa has her own business. She has been busy selling food items for more than 15 years. She sells food items in a food shop. Her food shop is located in the center of her village. In her food shop, she sells juices, pasta, candies, biscuits, meat products, etc. She periodically increases her working capital. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 (somoni) to buy food items to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel operates his own farm to make a living. For many years of farming, the couple earns well to provide for the family. He was working on his farm while raising large cattle to sell in the future. He borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm, as they have planned. In the future, he wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is a 25-year-old and is separated from her husband. She settled to earn her living in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Over the past four years, Emerlyn was able to have a food production business making and selling polvoron that absolutely met their needs. The business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures.

Emerlyn joined GDMPC earlier this year to have easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative has been approved. The money taken is intended to buy more raw ingredients to prepare polvoron for sale. Emerlyn expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients to prepare polvoron for sale

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa has been toying with the idea of having a transport business. She wants to help her husband earn additional income. The family lives in Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City where they also stationed their business. Maintaining a membership with the cooperative is what Felisa is thankful for. She was able to purchase a motorcycle unit and was able to save a portion of their income. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase spare motor parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, age 41, is happy tending her little store. She is widow with three kids. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. Sally keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Sally believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Sally has reached her third year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan for the store to purchase additional canned goods, shampoos, beverages and soft drinks. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there, afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoos, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en: Erenia is a businesswoman who sells a variety of fish. At the age of 70, she is a widow. She bravely stands to provide food on their table. Fish selling is a business she loves to do. She hopes to continually expand her business to neighboring towns. This business proposal was presented to PMPC and was released with a loan to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She is a businesswoman from Malaubang, Ozamiz. Her store supports the income of her husband and has been doing well for 4 years. Lilia is a full pledge member of PMPC and has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, sugar, oil. 

Lilia hopes to sustain her little business and would love to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, sugar, oil

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 34 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants palay.

Jenny wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan to pay for labor of land preparation and seedbed., so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to pay for labor of land preparation and seedbed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from vegetables and coconut wine vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Anita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is 53-years-old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosevilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Rosevilla has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, toothpaste, noodles, eggs, etc. and earns additional income from her restaurant business. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosevilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, coffee, cream, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Maria has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, coffee, cream, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung would like to take a further loan to buy another cow to raise and sell. Dung's previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more fishing net.

Divina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fishing net

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado y su esposa hace las labores del hogar, tiene 3 hijos quienes asisten a la escuela de la comunidad.


A los 10 años de edad, Carlos aprendió el oficio de agricultor por su padre, luego inició como ayudante de albañilería y ahora sabe el oficio, el lugar donde cultiva está a 900 mts de su casa y lo hace junto con sus 3 hijos

El crédito será invertido para producir 7,000 mts de maíz, ya que Carlos no cuenta con el capital suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos.


El sueño de Carlos es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, que sus hijos estudien y que la producción de este año sea muy buena.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old, he studied until the 6th grade, he has a partner who is a housewife and has 3 children who attend the local school.

When he was 10 years old, Carlos learned how to farm from his father. He then began working as a builder’s assistant and knows the trade. The area of land he cultivates is 900m from his house and he works it together with his 3 children.

The loan will be invested to produce 7,000m of corn, as Carlos does not have sufficient capital to cover all of the costs.

It is Carlos’ dream to improve the quality of life of his family, for his children to study and that this year’s production is very good.

loans.use: to produce 7,000m of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings so that she can expand her business

loans.name: Moumen

texts.en:
Moumen, age 21 and unmarried, offers vehicle repair services to earn a living. He started his business because of his love for cars and has been operating his enterprise for four years. He lives with his parents and four siblings in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. His business provides a good financial support for his family.

Moumen is seeking a youth loan in order to buy oil to offer for sale as well as to open a car wash. He is confident that that this investment will increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy oil to offer for sale as well as to open a car wash

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han is a villager from the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. He is 61 years old and a married father of eight children. To feed the family, he is growing rice as theIR main source of income. Sometimes he also works as a paid worker to earn more income for his family. He has been in this business for 11 years. 

Han has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two past loans with successful repayment. Hi previous loans have had a positive impact on his family. Now, he is seeking the loan for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. He is planning to use his entire loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for his farmland. He hopes that his rice will produce a greater yield for him than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for his farmland

loans.name: Yoeuy

texts.en:
Yoeury, age 46, grows rice and pineapples to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 11 years. She has six children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Yoeury is requesting her third loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is planning to use her entire loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. 

She is confident that her business will improve thanks to this micro-loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah operates a food stall business to earn her living. She has run her business for 10 years, selling her wares from her home on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her food stall is her sole income-generating activity.
 
Hadjah and her husband have six children, five of whom attend school. She also takes care of grandchildren. The family resides in a rented house and has access to electricity but not to piped water. Their monthly expenses include school fees and rent.
  
Hadjah has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of its good customer care. She will use her loan funds to buy cassava, banana fingers, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, cabbages, and eggplants. 

Hadjah aspires toward eventually becoming a wholesaler. She also has a goal of buying a plot of land where she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava, banana fingers, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, cabbages, and eggplants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 54 years old and has been farming since he was a small boy. He grew up with his parents and his grandfather, all of whom farmed from an early age, growing basic grains and taking care of laying hens. William didn't go to school, as back in those days it was difficult to access education due to poverty, so he learned to farm and raise poultry from his grandfather. As time passed he gained experience and knowledge about these activities and decided to farm on his own and create a home with his wife, who is a domestic employee. Together they are parents of two children.
