The loan will be used to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and pay labor to begin growing rice and corn and prepare a wire fence around his land as a form of security and confidence for when he is not being with his crops while he is enjoying time with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and pay labor to begin growing rice

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: The 51-year-old client lives with his family in his own house. Jose works in agriculture. He plants corn and rice. He has been doing this work for ten years and it is how he earns a living. He is a hardworking and responsible man who is very well known in the area for his huge heart and kindness towards others. As it is planting season, he decided to start preparing for it. It is for this reason that he has decided to request this new loan from ASKI. He will invest it in the purchase of seeds, compost, insecticides, etc. He will also improve the cropland shown in the photograph. He trusts in God that with your help, his dedication, and his effort, he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn operates a general store business to earn an income. She has run her business for several years now, and she tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her store, continuously offering new products and better service to her customers.

Arlyn has requested a loan in order to buy grocery items to offer for sale. With her loan funds, she will be able to keep her establishment open, continue stocking her inventory, repay debts to suppliers, and offer a greater variety with which to satisfy her customers' diverse tastes and needs. The loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Arlyn.
 
This loan will allow Arlyn to experience greater financial stability and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is single and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Virginia has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Angeila

texts.en:
Angeila is 36 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Angeila has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Angeila has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and single she works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a direct selling natasha(name of the products), avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like perfumes, shirt, pants, lotion, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like perfumes, shirt, pants, lotion, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 56 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains. Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kevin Darío

texts.es: Kevin Darío, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Kevin Darío is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who are older than he.  He will use the money from this loan to buy replacement parts to repair his vehicle which is very important for transporting supplies to his farm.  He expects to do good repairs on his vehicle and be able to have the materials on the farm when he needs them.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR and had not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan much easier and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his farm vehicle.

loans.name: Laihorng

texts.en:
Laihorng is 26 years old and married. She has two children who are too young for school. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Prasat Balang district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for several years.

Laihorng has been with VisionFund for three cycle. She successfully used the previous loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. She wants to use her loan to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Kimoun Thorng's Group

texts.en:
Kimoun, 28, is married and has two little kids under her dependency. She deals with her family’s financial burden via rice cropping and soy bean planting. She has been involved in the current business for eight years, and she can earn almost 39,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan for her and her joint borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has enabled her to support her family timely. Now, she and her co-borrower are applying for 200,00 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy school supplies for her kids. She hopes this loan will enable her to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her kids.

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Borey Cholsa district of Takeo province, Lieng is aged 51 years. She is widow with one child who is too young for school. In order to support the family, she has earned a living through farming rice for 27 years and selling some groceries for 14 years. With these current businesses, she can earn 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first micro loan for Lieng with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy more groceries for selling. With these loans, she hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Phay

texts.en:
Phay, 60, lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province’s Samki Meanchey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 35 years, and they supplement family’s income by selling grocery items. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Phay has been a member with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for 11 loan cycles and has completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. Now, she is applying for a new loan. She is going to use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Savath

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Borey Cholsa district of Takeo province, Savath is aged 33 years. She is married with two children, one of whom is in school, and another is too young for school. In order to support the family, she and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 20 years and raising pigs for four years. With these current businesses, she and her husband can earn 58,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first micro loan for Savath with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to buy pig feeds for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland and food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos and Alonso are two community firemen fighting forest fires in Villaflores, Chiapas. They need 50,000 MXP to start a community recycling program. The program will reduce landfill pollution and provide an extra income source for more than 10 families. 

Carlos and Alonso have already set up the collection routes and they have secured a buyer for the 5 Tons of plastic they will collect each month. With this loan, Carlos and Alonso will have the money to buy the plastic compactor machine they need to start the recycling program.

loans.use: to buy a plastic compactor machine to start a community recycling program

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is 34 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She doesn’t have any children. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 12,500 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Un with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 64 years old and a widow. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Boribo district of Kompong Chnang province. She has two dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in a local area. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 18,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for San from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she will apply for a new loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is 57 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She doesn’t have any children. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 11,100 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Lorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 42 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She doesn’t have any children. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 13,800 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Touch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 27-year-old married father of one and the sole breadwinner of his family. Four years ago, he opened a mobile phones selling shop with the guidance of his cousins, who were already in the business. His business has had a hard time growing since he lives in an area of conflict where the economic climate is risky.

Khodor is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more mobile phones and accessories as a means to increase his revenue. 

In the future, he intends to expand his business to service all his clients’ mobile phones' needs.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and accessories to increase his revenue.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 39-year-old married father of two children who are enrolled in a private school. He has worked in performing necessary maintenance to washing machines, refrigerators, freezers and many other electric machines since fifteen years ago.

Youssef is a hard worker who provides his services to customers in several nearby regions to make sure he can increase his income and develop his family's living.

Today, Youssef is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing tuition fees, since his business income combined with his wife's can barely cover their family's needs.

Youssef hopes to stay capable of providing his children with the best education.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school costs

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en:
Shamsiya is 48 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are 19 and 15 years. Shamsiya has been busy with sewing for more than five years. She sews kurpacha (Uzbek national mattress), scatter, and women dresses. 

She sells her products at a local market and has regular customers. Shamsiya manages with this business alone. She, little by little, develops her business. 

Shamsiya sews her products at her house. Now, she is going to buy a new, modern sewing machine because her sewing machine is old. Shamsiya is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to increase working capital.

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr: Monsieur papa est un jeune homme agé de 33ans qui habite à coté du Guichet. Marié et père de deux enfants, il est commercant et a une expérience de plus de 1 dans cette activité. Il demande ce pret d'un montant de 150.000F   pour acheter des denrées alimentaires pour ensuite les revendre. Il gère les charges et dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Il démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il souhaite à l'avenir développer son commerce et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Papa is a young man, 33 years old, who lives next door to the lending branch. He is married and the father of two children, and has run a shop for more than a year as his business.

Papa is requesting this loan of 150,000 francs CFA to be able to purchase various food products to resell them. He is responsible for the support and daily expenses of his family. Papa begins his day at 8am and works until 6pm. He hopes to expand his business in the future and to grow his profits in order to be able to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale

loans.name: La Puissance 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Josiane is a young mother of two living in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. In order to create a better life for herself and her family, for the last three years Josiane has run a small drinks business in one of Brazzaville's largest markets. As a member of the community bank group LA PUISSANCE 2 (1), Josiane would like to take out a loan of 400,000 CFA to invest in her business. With this loan, she would purchase additional boxes of juice, sodas and imported beverages to sell.

Josiane is on her fifth loan cycle with HOPE Congo and helps lead a subgroup of 11 micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville. In the future Josiane hopes to open her own shop selling drinks, and also expand to food items. One day she even hopes to buy her own piece of land and build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of juice, sodas and imported beverages to sell

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged between ten and seventeen. She sells fruit and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruit for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments and corn

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente earns an income by offering motorcycle transportation services. His wife brings in extra income from operating a retail store. They have one child. Their goal is eventually to be able to send their child to college. 

Vicente has borrowed a loan from GDMPC in order to cover maintenance costs for his motorcycle. 

His goal is to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to cover essential maintenance costs for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ndava Group

texts.fr:
Elisabeth fait partie du groupe Ndava  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Elle a 30 ans  et est mariée  à Louis, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de  2 à 12 ans  dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de sel et d’huile de palme   depuis  14  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de sel et d'huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a member of Ndava Group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 30 years old and is married to Louis, a farmer. Together they have four children, ranging in age from 2 to 12 years, three of whom attend school.

Elisabeth has been selling salt and palm oil for 14 years. This is her first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she is receiving, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of salt and palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

In the future, Elisabeth would like to purchase a plot of land and see her children attend school.

loans.use: To increase her capital and to purchase a large quantity of salt and palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Soklay

texts.en:
Soklay, age 30, grows and harvests rice and beans to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, earning about 19,300 KHR per day. She has two small children and lives in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province.

Soklay is a first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan funds to buy cashew seeds, which she will plant, grow, and harvest as a source of extra income for her family. 

Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living through this investment.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds, which she will plant, grow, and harvest as a source of extra income for her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and air conditioner to use in her house.

loans.name: Sokcheat

texts.en:
Sokcheat is 33 years old and a father of three children. He lives in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. To make for the family living, he has been working as a carpenter in his village, and sometimes he also works for others for a fee. He has been involved in this business for 13 years, and he can earn approximately 16 USD per day to support his family. 

This is the fourth micro loan for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully paid back, and it has enabled him to buy one decent motorbike for commuting with his family. 

Now, he is seeking a new loan in order to buy materials for supporting his business. He strongly believes in improving his standard of living better than before.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting his business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Budharaja Shg Group

texts.en: Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Bargarh district of Odisha, India, Sachi is 45 years old and married. The lady standing with her hand raised is Sachi. She and her husband have two children and earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 4,000 INR per month to support her family. This is the first loan for Sachi with Kiva’s partner, People's Forum. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay harvesting fees. She hopes to have a bigger crop yield to sell at a good price and improve her lifestyle. All the members of this " Budharaja Shg" self-help group are from the same village and all the group members are engaged in different business activities like milk selling, animal rearing, etc. All are very happy and grateful for this support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Gayatri SHG" Self Help Group consists of 11 members from a small village in Bargarh district, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them want to struggle harder to get ahead. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Renuka. In the picture, she is the lady sitted with her hand raised. She sells vegetables. Through her job, she works to support her family and improve her business and continue growing. She is a very determined person. She is seeking part of this group loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.name: Nilakanthaswar Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, nine women from Nayagarh district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named Nilakanthaswar Self Help Group. The members of Nilakanthaswar Self Help Group are all women from a small village of Nayagarh district in Odisha, India. One of them is Minati, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her  hand raised is Minati.

Minati got the idea of doing paddy and vegetable cultivation from People's Forum, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started with growing only few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourds, snake gourds, cucumbers, lady fingers (okra) and brinjals (eggplants). She has very good relationships with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to them. Now she has a new idea to rent some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale and do paddy cultivation also. For this she has requested a loan to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers and to get a water-pumping facility.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers and to get a water-pumping facility for her farmland

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 34-year-old mother from Kisumu city, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married to  Opar who also does business to support the family. They have been blessed with two children who are 11 and 13 years old.

She has a retail shop where she sells auto spares, a business she has been doing for the last six years and  generates a monthly income of KES. 30,000.Florence has applied for her third loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to buy more stock of spare parts for sale. She will use the anticipated income to take her children to school and boost the business, too.

Her dream is to have a stable business so that she can support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old single man who is financially responsible for a family of five. He had to quit school early in order to provide for his family. He previously worked as a chef in a hotel for four years, and in the last few months, he started a new job at a diet center.

Mahmoud has a positive vision in life and has been raised with good family values, which have guided him throughout his challenges. 

He acquired a Youth loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to cover some of the costs of his upcoming wedding. Mahmoud's determination and ambition will surely provide him with future success in his work and marriage.

loans.use: to cover some of the costs of his upcoming wedding.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of five children and none of whom goes to school. She has a business of selling charcoal, and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shilling (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from home seven days out of every week. She generates additional income from renting rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and build more rental rooms. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes paying utility bills and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase diesel fuel and some gravel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Asyl

texts.ru: Асыл, 33 года, замужем, 4 детей. Среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она с 2006 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Асыл знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Благодаря упорному труду в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и 1 теленок. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища. Также есть собственный земельный надел размером 0,40 ГА и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли, где выращивают картофель, сеют зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Дополнительно Асыл оказывает швейные услуги местному населению. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асыл обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров, часть средств будет потрачена на покупку семян картофеля элитных сортов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Asyl is 33 years old, married and has four children.  She has a high school education and since 2006, has been raising livestock and farming to obtain supplemental income.  Asyl knows how to create a correct financial plan to reach a specific goal.  Thanks to Asyl's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and one calf.  She has all of the necessities to keep and to raise livestock: a barn and a pasture. She also leases a plot of land of 0.4 hectares and another one of 2.0 hectares, where she grows potatoes, grain crops and sainfoin.  

In addition, Asyl provides sewing services to the local residents.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Nurisa turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to purchase milk cows and seeds for elite varieties of potatoes.  She is planning to use some profits from her business to expand her herd and to use the rest for building of a large barn for her animals.

loans.use: To buy milk cows and seeds for potatoes

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
A primeras horas de la mañana un ambiente cálido y fresco rodea la casa de Gumercinda, una vez que ha tomado su cafecito caliente, el que la mantiene activa en una largo día de trabajo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de maíz.  Ella tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Hace nueve años inició en el negocio de la siembra y crianza, actividades que son su única fuente de ingresos. Es una mujer emprendedora y atenta, siempre está al tanto de su ganado, les alimenta y brinda un buen cuido; asimismo a su siembra.
Ella solicita el segundo crédito puesto que la temporada de cosecha se acerca y requiere comprar abono para la fertilización de la tierra y pagar a jóvenes la siembra y riego del cultivo, puesto que ella sola no puede realizar dicha actividad. Gumercinda está muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, con el que logró mejorar  las condiciones de los potreros. Ella asegura que el préstamo le será de mucha ayuda porque logrará realizar las labores de siembra sin complicación, lo que le brindara ingresos y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the early hours of the morning, a warm and dry environment surrounds the house of Gumercinda. Once she has had her coffee, which keeps her active in a long day of work, she dedicates herself to cattle breeding and corn cultivation. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. Nine years ago she began in the business of planting and breeding, activities that are her only source of income. She is an entrepreneurial and attentive woman. She is always aware of her livestock; she feeds them and gives them good care, the same as with her plant crops. 

She is requesting the second loan being as the harvest season is approaching and she needs to buy manure for the fertilization of the earth and to pay youths for the planting and irrigation of the crop, insomuch that she cannot make said activity happen alone. Gumercinda is very grateful for the first finance of Kiva through MiCredito, with which she achieved improving the paddock conditions. She ensures that the loan will be much help to her because she will accomplish making the labors of planting happen without complication, which will bring her income and better life conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure for the fertilization of the earth and to pay youths for the planting and irrigation of the crop.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 29 years old and she lives in the village of Lchashen in Gegharkunik region. She graduated from Sevan State Pedagogical College, but she never worked in her specialty as a teacher. For several years, Narine used to work at the kindergarten as a cook. 

Now her only occupation is farming, and in the village her farm is the most famous for specializing in swine breeding. In this hard and rather profitable work, Narine’s husband greatly helps her. On her farm, Narine has 26 pigs and 30 piglets. From her farm, she sells great amounts of pork, fresh and of high quality. She says that she sells the pork to butchers and also to the owners of sausage plants or supermarkets. So, she considers her occupation rather profitable, but she says since the number of her farm cattle is great, she always has a lack of fodder.

Narine has a daughter; she is 7 years old and in her first year of school.

Narine asks for a loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of fodder for her pigs and keep them fed.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her pigs and keep them fed.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz es una mujer que dedico su vida en empresas de servicios generales, en tales empresas vendía a sus compañeros de trabajo Fritos que realizaba en su casa, poco tiempo después renuncio a su empresa y se dedicó de lleno a la venta de fritos en un “local” que adecuo al frente de su casa, con el cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Durante el ultimo tiempo ha tenido una gran dificultad y es el problema de orden publico que afecta a su barrio, este es un problema tanto para su negocio como para su familia pues sus hijos están creciendo en medio de un conflicto barrial, con la incursión de la policía  y colaboración de todo el barrio esta problema ha venido mejorando, es aquí donde Beatriz quiere aportar su granito de arena demostrando que de una situación como esta se sale con trabajo y esfuerzo por ende solicita una colaboración crediticia para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, un molino eléctrico y surtido para su Micro negocio con el cual pueda continuar el progreso de su negocio hasta tener el capital suficiente para montar un almacén y generar empleo que es su más grande deseo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a woman who dedicated her life to businesses in general services. In such businesses she used to sell an assortment of fried snacks that she made in her house to her coworkers. Shortly after she quit at her business and she dedicated herself fully to the sale of fried snacks in a "locale" that she set up in the front of her house, with which she has been able to help her husband with the costs of the home.

Recently she has had a hard time, and it is the problem of law and order that affects her neighborhood. This is a problem for her business as well as for her family as her children are growing up in the middle of a neighborhood conflict. With the incursion of the police and collaboration of the entire neighborhood, this problem has been getting better. It is here that Beatriz wants to contribute her bit, demonstrating that from a situation like this you come out with work and strength. This is why she is requesting a credit collaboration; for the purchase of a fast food car, an electric mill and range for her Microbusiness, with which she could continue to progress with her business until she has the sufficient capital to create a store and to generate work, as this is her greatest wish.

loans.use: to purchase a fast food car, an electric mill and range to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru:
Сокина позитивная и трудолюбивая девушка, ей 27 лет. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. По состоянию здоровья он не смогла выйти замуж и сейчас живёт вместе со своими родителями. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Сокина никогда не сидит без дела. Она старается делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать себя и своих родителей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Сокина начала свой бизнес. Она занимается животноводством. Сокина выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Родители Сокины также помогают ей в ее деле.  И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Сокина хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Сокина заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Sokina is a positive and hardworking 27 year-old young woman.  She is not married and does not have children. Due to her health, she was not able to get married and now lives with her parents. She lives in a small village. Although, she is always at home, Sokina never sits without doing anything. She tries to do everything possible to provide herself and her parents with all of the necessities.

Sokina started her own business in order to have a regular income for food. She is involved in animal husbandry. Sokina raises livestock and then sells meat and milk. She earns a good income from this business. Sokina's parents also help her with the business, and for now they do not have enough money to cover all of the existing needs. At the present time, Sokina wants to buy several more heads of livestock for fattening up. This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Sokina thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which would result in an improvement in her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Abesigamukama Farmers Group

texts.en: Mable previously used her Kiva loan to buy more chairs that she rents to the public for functions, being a festive season in which there were many activities. Mable made a fortune, since she charges per chair. She will now use this loan to pay tuition for her daughter at the university whose exam's are due in a month's time. She and the group members thank Ugafode for the continued support and partnership which has enabled them to change their stories for better. Thank you Kiva lenders. One of the members is resting from the loan this cycle.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Abakundine Group- Rubaare

texts.en:
Abakundine is a new group located in the Ntungamo district of Uganda. They are residents of a rural area whose major activity is farming.  They applied for a loan as a group, which they will divide amongst themselves.  They have a challenge of low production within their farming due to poor farming methods, inadequate and poor seedlings. They hope to improve their farming, but they are limited by capital and funds to enable them to achieve their dreams. 

Hope, a member of the group will use the money to buy better seeds for sowing during the planting season.  She thinks this will increase her productivity and lead to a bountiful harvest.  This will in the long run improve her income base. She is hard working and thanks the group members for standing by her side and the lenders for the great services.  The gentleman in a tie back-right is the Ugafode staff.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en:
John Baptist is a 41-year-old farmer from Kyarwera cell in Ruhunga, a rural area in Ibanda district. He is married and has four children, who are all in school.

John deals in small-scale agriculture, which he adds to with a local alcohol-brewing business. He earns income to feed his family and to pay school fees for his children. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to help him buy more bananas and pay tuition for his children. He will ripen the bananas and make banana juice for trade.

John Baptist is a very hard-working man. He hopes to construct a permanent home for his family, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy bananas and pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.en:
Suzanne is the featured borrower of Lolo group. She and the other group members have been best friends for years and they have acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to improve their financial livelihood.

Suzanne is a 39-year-old married mother of six. Her husband is a hotel employee. Twenty years ago, she started her own tailoring business from home in an effort to assist her husband in earning for the household. With her loan, Suzanne hopes to increase her sales by purchasing a set of fabrics to design a new collection of clothes for the coming summer months. In the future, she intends to grow her home business even more and provide her children with a better future. Suzanne is the lady at the center of the picture with the green top.

As for the other group members, Lina is the second member of the group and she is sitting on the far left side while Rania is on far right side with a white top.

loans.use: To increase her sales by purchasing a set of fabrics to use to design a new collection of clothes for the  summer months

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 28-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He is a father of one child. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs. 

Two years ago, Yousef started his own project, which is a chicken farm. It is a very good business, and the income is high. 

Yousef took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks for his farm. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to improve his farm and increase the productivity. 

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en:
Nidjat is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents and sister in the Baku region. They are internally displaced persons-IDPs from their home in Shusha city. Nidjat is a taxi driver, which he has been doing for seven years.  

Nidjat requested a loan for 600 AZN, which he will use to repair his car's engine. In the future, he wants to increase his business and change his car.

loans.use: to repair his car's engine

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en:
Gulbaniz, a 46-year-old single woman, lives with and assists  her elderly parents. For the past year she has been breeding cows, earning a monthly income of 200AZN.

Animal husbandry is widespread in Azerbaijan because there is a high demand for milk and meat. Gulbaniz fattens cows and then sells them for a profit. Additionally, she makes dairy products from the milk and sells them too. Local people buy from Gulbaniz everyday because the products she sells are always fresh and tasty. 

Gulbaniz needs additional income to cover her family's needs, which include medicines. She therefore wants to expand her business and build a farm where she can breed not only cows but also bulls, sheep and chickens. Gulbaniz is requesting this 1200AZN loan in order to buy two additional cows and increase productivity. This will help her reach her goal of better assisting her parents.

loans.use: to build a farm and increase productivity

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is 47 years old. She is the only provider for her child. She is divorced. Gulruhsor has experienced many difficulties in life. She is a highly educated person. She has worked more than 13 years in a local school. She teaches math. She likes her job and works with pleasure. 

Gulruhsor always dreams of seeing her child with a higher education. Now, her child has graduated school. He is going to enter the university. Gulruhsor is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to pay for his tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her child's tuition

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Because Taghreed is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Taghreed is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her only son. Taghreed has been selling Arabic style seating furniture and clothes for three years to support her husband in covering their only son's needs. Now, to raise her profit, she is seeking a youth loan to buy more Arabic style seating furniture that her customers have been requesting.

loans.use: To buy more Arabic style seating furniture to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the rent on the land and to prepare the land for growing.

loans.name: Karomatkhon

texts.en: Karomatkhon was born in 1958. She teaches physics in a local school in her region. She has worked at this school for more than 23 years. She enjoys teaching. She has a lot of pupils. Karomatkhon tries to teach physics to her pupils well. She is a careful mother also. Karomatkhon’s husband sells food items. For the last year they want to repair their home but their income is small. Karomatkhon is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials like cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: José Silverio

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado. Es casado, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 3 viven en casa, él es seguridad.

José tiene 9 años de dedicarse al trabajo de seguridad, lo aprendió por su padre. A parte de eso se dedica a la agricultura, viaja en bus urbano y en el trabajo agrícola se involucran 3 de sus hijos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra.  Esto mejorara su vida y podrá cultivar y tendrá ingresos y productos agrícolas.  En un futuro planea mejorar su condición de vida y poder cumplir sus sueños de que su cultivo se desarrolle bien y tenga un buen rendimiento.
texts.en:
José, 42 years old, attended school until the sixth grade. He is married with five children. Three live at home. He has worked in security for nine years and learned the job from his father. In addition, he also farms, traveling on an urban bus, and three of his children help him with the agricultural work.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase compost, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides and to pay labor costs. This will improve his life and he will be able to farm and will have earnings and agricultural products. In the future, he plans to improve his living conditions and fulfill his dreams of seeing his crops grow well and yield good harvests.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and a mother to their children. Evelyn, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She earns a minimum of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of her house for rent. 

Evelyn hopes to be successful in business and in life. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her house for rent.

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en:
Kulusum is married and has seven children who attend school. She has a business of selling green bananas, which she has been doing for three years. She sells on a retail basis five days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Kulusum requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 900,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas. She hopes to becoming a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William's business of goats was given a new shape when he got a financial boost from Kiva lenders through Ugafode previously.
His customer base increased and so did his profit, since he was able to buy at a much cheaper price in bulk. He wishes to get another loan to buy more goats for grazing and to sell later. He is hard-working and focused. Thank you, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy baby goats that he will feed and sell.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a woman with a kind heart. She is married and has three children. Her husband is Olimjon. Olimjon is a builder. 

For more than 12 years, Malika has been busy with a bakery. She cooks flatbreads and sells them in a local market. Her working day begins at 5am. She works hard to run her business. Her children help her with cooking bread. She also has additional income from animal husbandry. 

Malika is going to repair her house and build a bathroom. Her son is going to organize his marriage party. Malika wants to finish repairing her house for her son’s marriage party. 

Malika is asking for a loan of TJS 7,000 (somoni) to buy materials, such as cement, wood, and bricks to repair the house and build the bathroom. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and bricks to repair her house and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 35 años de edad, padre  responsable  con dos hijos menores de edad, el cual están estudiando. Es originario de  Achuapa lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboracion de ladrillos y bloque de barro el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. El dedica a su negocio unas dies horas diaris ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Miguel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como  es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Miguel is thirty-five years old and is the responsible father of two young children who are studying in school.  He is originally from Achuapa, a place located in the northern part of the region.  He is known for being hardworking, responsible, and very determined to make himself better.  Unfortunately, he was not able to study due to a lack of economic resources.  He therefore began working from a young age so that he could help cover some of the home expenses.

Thanks to his efforts to move himself ahead, he works making bricks and mud blocks out of a workshop in his house.  He dedicates ten hours each day to working and offering these products.  

With the loan, he hopes to invest in working capital and to stock his business so that he can begin making better profits in the not-too-distant future.  Miguel is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to people from limited means and poor countries, like Nicaragua, in order to take part in decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to manufacture bricks and mud blocks

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 24-year-old married father of two who has been repairing car tires for the last nine years. He now manages a scrap shop that he acquired from his father and uncles, who had trained him in the field. 

Since Mouhamad is a Palestinian refugee and lives in a refugee camp with limited work opportunities and wide competition, he has faced and mostly overcome many obstacles in managing his shop.

He is the sole earner in his family, and he makes enough to just get by. As a consequence, Mouhamad can't afford to send his two children to school. He acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise, which promises progress in new extra income. 

In the future, he intends to explore a certain piece of land to enlarge his market in more scrap and pre-used electronics.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise, which promises progress with new extra income.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
La Sra. Daysi es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  sus  padres y  sus hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   venta  de  ropa  y granos basicos.
Doña Daysi el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de mercadería como cargas de maíz, cargas de frijoles, quintales de arroz y quintales de azúcar. Con  el préstamo ella espera tener más producto que ofrecer para  poder cubrir la demanda  de los  clientes que en  esta temporada  alta  recibe.
Y con los ingresos obtenidos mejorar su situación económica y la de la familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio sea  el  más  grande de la   zona. Gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos, y convertido en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del  2014
texts.en:
Daysi's a very responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her parents and her children in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling clothing and basic grains.

Deysi needs the loan to buy merchandise such as loads of corn, loads of beans, quintals of rice, and quintals of sugar.  With the loan she hopes to have more products to sell so she can cover the high customer demand of this season.

With the income she receives she'll improve her family's economic situation.  In the future she hopes her business will be the biggest in the area, thanks to the investment. She dreams of seeing her children become good people with better opportunities for society.

Choluteca, Honduras, April 2014

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as corn, beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been a customer of Visionfund Kapsabet for more than five years.  He is very grateful for the loans we have been advancing to him and more especially the recent one for 80,000 KES.

With the loan, he managed to expand his business to another level.

loans.use: to purchase timber, block-board, triply, nails, and different types of materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Haniceta

texts.en:
Haniceta helps her husband, working on their farm for a living. Farming is their main source of income. Aside from planting and growing different kinds of crops, she also raises pigs for sale.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Now she is preparing for the next planting season. For this, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Andres Jr.

texts.en:
Andres Jr. owns and manages a farm while his wife runs a general store to make a living. He always finds ways how to improve his farm and many ways to generate profit. 

He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for his farm.  Recently, he took a new loan  to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer.  He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, comenta que gracias a los crédito posee mejores condiciones de vida junto a su familia, ya que con las inversiones hechas ha mejorado la productividad y calidad de las cosechas, dándole mejores ingresos los cuales han servido para cancelar la deuda y cubrir gastos familiares.
El nuevo financiamiento le servirá para pagar mano de obra para la limpiar el terreno en el que cultivara maíz, frijol y macillo, así mantenerse trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en: Felipe tells us that thanks to the loan, he, along with his family, has better living conditions, since with the investments made, he has improved the productivity and quality of his harvests, giving him better income, which has served to pay off the debt and cover the family expenses. The new loan will serve him to pay for labor to clean the land where he raises corn, beans, and sorghum, to thus keep him working in agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clean his land

loans.name: Kupia Kumi Group

texts.es:
Jennely: Es una señora emprendedora y amistosa, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Kupia Kumi (que en lengua miskita significa Un Solo Corazón); está integrado por tres mujeres, que se organizaron con el propósito  de buscar alternativas de financiamiento mediante crédito en Pana Pana, para poder mejorar sus negocios e ingresos, que les permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, para poder cubrir necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y vivienda.

Esta amable señora, es originaria de Waspam, casada, tiene 8 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y ha establecido en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera, una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca de ropa en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Waspam, y comprar productos para su pulpería. Su sueño es tener un local en el mercado, que su negocio crezca y apoyar en el desarrollo profesional de sus hijos.

Martha Alejandra: Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se dedica a la venta de fritos y de ropa usada. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca mixta de ropa usada en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Waspam. Tambien comprará insumos para elaborar frito: aceite, carbón, pilipitas, repollo, sal, tomate, pollo, chiltoma, cebolla, vinagre, pepino, ingredientes y especies para preparar el pollo y bolsas plásticas, los productos los vende de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Waspam. Su sueño es ampliar su pequeño negocio, tener una pulpería en el mercado de Waspam.

Mandelina: Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca de cartera y ropa para niños en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Waspam. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, tener una pulperia.
texts.en:
Jennely is a friendly and enterprising woman who is the coordinator of the “Kupia Kumi” (which in Miskito language means “Of one Heart”) communal bank. It is composed of 3 women who got together with the aim of finding alternative financing through a loan from Pana Pana. They want to be able to improve their businesses and income which will permit them to improve the living standard of their families, to pay for the basic necessities of food, shelter and education.

Jennely is a likable woman who is native to Waspam. She is married and has 8 children, all of them are school-aged. For the past 8 years she has been selling used clothing and has opened a small store in the corridor of her house made of wood and built on stilts. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bale of clothing from Managua and sell them at accessible prices in the Municipality of Waspam and to buy products for her store. Her dream is to have a stall in the market to expand her business and support the professional development of her children.

Martha Alejandra has sold fried foods and used clothing for about 5 years. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua to re-sell it in the Municipality of Waspam at reasonable prices. She will also buy ingredients to make her fried foods (fritos): oil, charcoal, pilpita, cabbage, salt, tomato, chicken, chilies, onion, vinegar, cucumber, and spices to prapare the chicken and plastic bags. She sells the product in the streets of Waspam. Her dream is to have a stall at the market and expand her small business. Mandelina has sold used clothing for about 3 years. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bale of handbags and children's clothing in Managua to sell at accessible prices in Waspam. Her dream is to expand her business and to have a small store.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing for resale and buy products for her small store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, fish, meat, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 38-year-old married lady from Gaza City. She lives with her husband and two kids, a boy and a girl, in a small house. Maryam opened a small beauty salon in the city three years ago. It is a good business and she has good experience in this field. Maryam would like to improve her salon and expand it.
 
Maryam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new beauty products and a hair dryer. By taking this loan, Maryam will be able to improve her salon and also her income. 

Maryam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new beauty products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more feed for his animal farm.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is a 33-year-old married man with three children. He lives in the Baki region with his family, but they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Agdam for over the 20 years. 

Parviz’s elder daughter is in the third class of school. Another daughter is going to first class and the youngest child is a  4 year-old boy who goes to kindergarden. 

Parviz is a welder who welds different construction areas by order. He has been in this business for 4 years. He wants to repair his damaged equipment  and  has applied to Komak  for 1,100 AZN. 

He is thankful to Kiva organization for this aid.

loans.use: to repair damaged equipmenet.

loans.name: Angel Jesus

texts.es:
Don Ángel es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el vive con su esposa en el Barrio las Crucitas, Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Desde hace mas de 40 años. 
Sus ingresos provienen de su empleo en la empresa HABITAD PARA LA HUMANIDAD desempeñándose como guardia de seguridad desde hace mas 6 años devengando el salario minimo en Honduras, con mucho esfuerzo don Ángel ha logrado emprender un negocio (vidriería) la cual es atendida por sus hijos, esto le genera más ingresos  a su economía. 
El está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para la vidriería ya que ahorita les han surgido bastantes trabajos y por falta de recursos económicos no ha comprado los materiales necesarios para hacer dichos trabajos. 
El espera con este préstamo poder comprar el material necesario para entregar los trabajos pendientes que tienen en la vidriería, y así hacer que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su pedidos a tiempo.
El espera que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos para en un futuro poder abastecer a muchas más personas, ya que su sueño es ayudar a su hijo para que pueda recibir una buena educación y ser una persona honesta y trabajadora.  



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – Abril-2014
texts.en:
Ángel is a very hardworking and responsible person. He has lived with his wife in the Las Crucitas neighborhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, for more than 40 years. 
His income comes from his employment at the NGO Habitat for Humanity where he has been a security guard for more than 6 years, earning minimum wage. With much effort, Ángel has been able to start a business as a glazier where he employs his children. This enables him to bring in more income. 
He is requesting a loan to buy materials for his glazing business as lots of jobs have just come up and, because of a lack of economic resources, he hasn't purchased the materials he needs for these jobs.  
He hopes that, with this loan, he will be able to buy the material he needs for the pending jobs at the glazing business and make sure that his customers have their orders fulfilled on time.  
He hopes that his business will keep growing and that he can keep working with these sorts of loans in the future so that he supply many more people. His dream is to help his son to get a good education and become an honest and hardworking person. 
Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras - Abril 2014.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum, and packaging for his business.

loans.name: Kelin Ester

texts.es:
Kelin es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con su madre y sus hermanas en la comunidad de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Una comunidad al norte de Honduras. Su actividad laboral es la venta de Ropa nueva y usada, Zapatos, Sandalias, lociones y más, en el barrio el centro de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortés.  dándole atención a toda la comunidad y personas que visitan de diferentes comunidades, lleva ya más de 4 años emprendiendo esta actividad comercial, Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas productos como ser ropa, zapatos, sandalias y Accesorios de dama, ella quiere tener mucha más variedad de productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes para así atraer a nuevos clientes a su negocio, Ella espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a él contara con los productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Kelin espera que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia. Y así poder tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Abril- 2014
texts.en:
Kelin is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives with her mother and her sisters in the community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortés, a community in the north of Honduras. Her work is the sale of new and used clothing, shoes, sandals, lotions and more, in the neighborhood in the center of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortés. She serves the entire community and people who visit from other communities. She has carried out this business for more than 4 years. She needs the loan to invest in products such as clothes, shoes, sandals, and women's accessories for her business.  She wants to have much more variety of products to offer her customers, and to attract new customers to her business. She hopes that the loan will help her a lot because, thanks to it, she will have the products needed to meet the needs of her customers, and to have more income that will increase her family's quality of life. 

Kelin hopes that her business will continue growing and in this way support her family and be able to have better opportunities in the future. 


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – April- 2014

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, sandals, and women's accessories for her business

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socios laborioso y coordinado por el señor Manfield de 25 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo quien es su motivación para salir adelante y poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida se dedica a la elaboración de bolsos y fajas en su domicilio y en el país vecino de Costa Rica, cuenta con la ayuda de la mamá y esposa para la elaboración de los productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales como es tela, zipper, forro, hilo, hebillas, adornos, etc. Los otros socios son la señora Fabiola de 32 años comerciante de ropa nueva y cosméticos de manera ambulante y el señor Eliezer de 26 años comerciante de calzado en los departamentos del país y en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking members and is coordinated by Señor Manfield who is 25 years old. He is married, and has a son who is his motivation to get ahead so he can offer him a better quality of life. He works making bags and belts in his home and in the neighbouring country of Costa Rica. He relies on his wife (the mother of his son) for making the products. 

He is asking for this loan in order to buy materials such as fabric, zippers, lining, thread, buckles, decorative elements, etc. The other members are Señora Fabiola who is 32 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics on a street stall, and Eliezer, who is 26 years old and sells footwear in his country, and in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, lining, thread etc.

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es: la señora Amalia de 29 años de edad acompañada y madre de dos hijos, es propietaria de una panadería en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su familia para la elaboración y venta del producto, también tiene trabajadores remunerados por lo que la producción es amplia y los comercializa en su domicilio y de manera ambulante en su comunidad, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado mejorar a su vivienda y también la compra de un soplete que es de beneficio para lograr mayor producción, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de  sartenes y materia prima como es harina, huevo, aceite, azúcar, levadura, leña, etc. La socia lleva 16 ciclos trabajando con la institución y ha demostrado ser una socia exitosa y muy trabajadora.
texts.en: Amalia is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and is the mother of two children. She is the owner of a bakery in her house. She has the help of her family in the production and sale of her product. She also has some employed workers and therefore, her production is ample. She sells in her house and as a street vendor in her community. With her previous loans she was able to improve her house and also buy a blowtorch, which is beneficial to get more production. She is requesting the loan to buy frying pans and basic ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, sugar, yeast, fire logs, etc. This partner has been  working with the institution for 16 cycles and has shown to be a successful and very hardworking partner.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, coloring, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella owns and operates a  farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale, to earn a living. She's been in business for eight years and it sustains her living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for her farm. 
 
She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve and expand it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase organic fertilizer in order to gain more return for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  provides a service-based business offering motor transportation in the local community.  He also operates a farm and earns additional money from other employment.  His wife operates a retail store. 

They earn enough income to have successfully repaid his previous business loans. Recently, he took a new loan to buy more grocery items to sell. They are determined to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rubber bowls, plates, spoons, and buckets for the business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Four years ago she began doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons and laces in different colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Samina hopes to grow her business for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and rent a space to have her merchandise on display permanently.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Raqia has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Don Marco, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea del Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Toda su vida la a dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café, maíz y frijol. El vende esta producción en la misma zona y mercados locales. Solicita un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, y pago de mano de obra para darle asistencia a sus cultivos de café, maíz y frijol y aumentar la producción. En un futuro piensa comprar un terreno para ampliar cultivos y obtener ingresos para darle mejor vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Marco is 55 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. He has been a farmer all his life, growing coffee, corn and beans. He sells this produce en the same area and local markets. 

He is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to assist him with his coffee, corn and bean crops and increase his yield. In the future he plans to buy a piece of land to increase his crops and make income to give his wife a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for laborers to assist in growing coffee, corn and beans.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children.  She has one buffalo and sells milk and butter to many of her neighbors. She has sold milk for  11 years.

Her business provides her with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, a good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business in order to meet daily expenses.  

This is her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation; she happily runs her business with their support. She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She hopes to increase the milk production  and therefore generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se sacrifica por poder salir adelante. Su actividad se basa en el servicio de transporte público, es decir que ella es dueña de un colectivo, que opera en forma interna, teniendo un recorrido que realiza en forma diaria desde hace varios años.
La Sra. Francisca pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, que le permitirá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus cliente, y seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
Francisca, 51, is from the city of Itá.  She's a very hardworking woman who strives and makes sacrifices to be able to get ahead.

Her job is in public transportations services.  That is, she owns a bus that she has operated internally on a daily route for several years.

Francisca's requesting this loan to be able to invest in maintaining her vehicle so she can keep on providing good customer service and striving, as she has always done.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her bus

loans.name: Roby Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured representative of Roby group. She and the other group members are best friends and got together to help each other improve their livelihoods, which is why they are acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua.

Nadia is a 49-year-old widowed mother of one, and she is responsible for the support of an additional family member. She has always been able to provide for her child after the death of her husband, through her work as a beautician. She has a university degree and 15 years of experience in the field, which has allowed her to attract a wide range of clients from around her neighborhood.
 
Nadia is acquiring a new loan from Kiva in order to renovate her salon furniture and purchase a new TV to provide her customers with entertainment while she works.  She is the lady with the green top at the center of the picture.

Hiba is the second member of the group and is sitting on the far right side of the picture, while Rina is on the left.

loans.use: To renovate her salon furniture and purchase a new TV to provide her customers with entertainment while she works

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 58 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios del hogar hace muchos años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sabanas y cubrecamas para expenderlos a sus vecinos  y al público. Pertenecer al grupo “CORAZON DE JESUS” le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia y poder iniciar la actividad a la cual hoy se dedica a sus 58 años. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la se encuentra sentada en el lado izquierdo viste chompa morado.
texts.en:
Rosa is fifty eight years old. She is married, with three independent children. She has sold clothing and home accessories for many years. The loan will be used to buy sheets and bedspreads which will be sold to her neighbors and to the public. Belonging to the Corazon de Jesus (Heart of Jesus) group has allowed her to improve her family’s quality of life and to start the business she runs now at age 58.

The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan they have offered.

Rosa is the person seated on the left wearing a purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат ответственная женщина. Она родилась в 1965 году. Фарогат вдова и воспитывает 3 детей. Фарогат уже давно более 23 лет занимается бизнесом. Она продает женскую одежду на местном рынке. Так как у нее большой опыт в данной сфере, так и она справляется с бизнесом с легкостью. Хотя в начале, ей было очень трудно. Фарогат постепенно развевала свой бизнес. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Фарогат запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 Сомони для покупки женской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farogat is a responsible woman. She was born in 1965. Farogat is a widow and she is raising three children. She has had a business for a long time already, more than 23 years.
